Reviews.Title: “Super Fun Yet Practical”
Reviews.Author: JBB_CT
Reviews.Content: I stay at the ZaZa when I come to Dallas for work but I'd definitely stay for pleasure too. The ZaZa is very trendy but you also get the things you need for work (like decent wi-fi) and you are in a very comfortable luxe environment. Definitely a first choice for me for Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Bridgeclimber
Reviews.Content: A totally different experience for 3 nights, after 3 nights at The Mansion!! Very funky and trendy - the furnishings were very smart and modern, with the adjoining sitting room very welcome and useful, together with desk and WiFi. Handy location with McKinley tram nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Truly enchanting!”
Reviews.Author: Baxter2698
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an "oasis" in the heart of the bustling downtown Dallas area. The service and staff is much more than I could have asked for. The gentleman that checked me in (which I apologize for not remembering his name) was very knowledgeable about the property and upgraded me to one of their concept suites. I appreciate his kind gesture! What a great surprise! Every staff member was relaxed and welcoming yet extremely professional and exuded luxury. Unique art pieces were sprinkled throughout the property. The pool area is relaxing and beautiful in the evening. Yet it reminds me of a posh, "place to be seen" somewhere in south beach. The food at the Dragonfly restaurant was refreshing and unique. My check-out was made personal and enjoyable by Morgan. She was friendly and seemed as though she really cared about how my stay was. She left me with a very positive and lasting impression of the property. My boyfriend and I truly enjoyed ourselves and we will be back! My very first stay at Hotel Zaza won me over! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Angela P
Reviews.Content: I was told to stay here while I was in Dallas for business and was in awe of the atmosphere and the excellent service I received. The staff was incredible, the surroundings were beautiful, and the hotel was so much more than what I have ever experienced with large, impersonal hotel chains. I highly, highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Jsokol
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, hip, centrally located within Dallas. Great amenities, descent health club, top restaurants nearby. The hotel is similar to a W type experience. Great pool side area, bar, friendly staff. Top hotel for the Dallas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Young G
Reviews.Content: Zaza is beautiful, unique, comfortable and fun. The Dragonfly is a great place to mingle with Dallas locals and visitors. The patio and pool are gorgeous and the gym is good enough. More than that, though, the rooms are large and comfortable. I wish I could splurge for one of the custom suites! Great hotel. Great service. Free valet (not overnight) and walking distance from restaurants, convenient stores, night life. Right in the middle of Dallas' McKinney Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but disappointing aftermath”
Reviews.Author: sandman9253
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the ZAZA on March 17th and had a fantastic time. Upon checkout I looked at our billing and it was correct except for the $8.00 tip we had charged to the room at breakfast. The front desk person told me that was ok, that it would post later. However, a few days after our stay, I reviewed my credit card billings on line and saw a $93.00 additonal charge from the ZAZA. I immediatley sent an email asking what the charges were for. I got a response and was told that (name omitted), front desk manager, would contact me. This was on Thursday, March 22. As of Tuesday, March 27, I had heard nothing. I sent another email and the response was "(Name omitted) took care of this." That is all fine and good, but I wanted an explanation. After a couple of back and forths, the following is an excerpt from the email I received from (Nameomitted), Guest Service Representative: ." Iâ€™ve attached a copy of your folio with these charges represented. Now, I went ahead and removed the mini-bar charge and posted it as a user error. But as far as the $8 tip at the Dragonfly, I am unable to authorize a credit for that transaction. If you would like to further discuss the charge, please, call me at the front desk and Iâ€™ll be more than happy to connect you to the General Manager at Dragonfly. I hope this issue has been resolved and if you have any other questions feel free to email me directly. Thank you for your patience. I hope you have a wonderful day(: " First of all, I never contested the $8.00 tip. Secondly, perhaps it is just my take, but it makes me feel like the hotel has given me credit to appease us; that they feel we ate, drank or whatever this stuff was that was charged to us. We ate, drank, used absolutely nothing form the mini-bar. We have stayed at the ZAZA for years and will really miss staying there.

Reviews.Title: “It's different and really enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: regulartravelman
Reviews.Content: On entering this hotel, you are instantly struck by the difference to other more "corporate" hotels. The look and feel is a little eccentric and the service from the staff is excellent. The rooms are very large and there are special themed rooms for selection if you so desire. Even though I used this hotel on abusiness trip it was refreshing to experience a hotel with a real difference without having to pay ridiculous prices. Its reasonably priced and well located in uptown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “St Paddy's Day”
Reviews.Author: Rutland A
Reviews.Content: The front desk was exceptionally friendly. They were having fun on St. Paddy's Day. Everything was great including the wine. It's a great way to wind down from a hard day of shopping and before getting dressed for the Dragonfly.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Bessie H
Reviews.Content: Scott at the front is always so helpful to make our dinner reservations for us when we dine outside of the hotel. He is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, big rooms, cool vibe..below average service”
Reviews.Author: whagwarning
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice sized rooms, and is well decorated. The vibe is quite cool, although the bar was very quite whilst i was in town. The service is way below average, probably some of the worst i have seen in america for a 5 star hotel..so dont stay here for the service! If you are going as a couple it is good for a weekend of loving..as a business traveller, hotel just felt a bit seedy and i was worried what germs were about in the room..as you know some filthy things have happened there due to the provided sex kits! in all i was a little disappointed by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Want to try a concept suite”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne K
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my time at this hotel. Wish I had enough money to come back and stay at one of those concept suites. I will work and save my money and will definitely be back. IT IS WORTH IT.

Reviews.Title: “Best french toast”
Reviews.Author: Peggie G
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adore this very quaint and social hotel! Great Pool and Bar Area. Popular place to be on a weekend, day or night for younger professionals (20's-40's) visiting or living in Dallas. The best French toast I've ever tasted!

Reviews.Title: “IN STYLE OH YES!”
Reviews.Author: lindathediver
Reviews.Content: words to describe: classy, entertaining atmosphere,upscale,nice staff, let me say this i felt very welcomed, this is a young people type of Hotel I would say, (and by the way I'm 55) its great for a weekend get away, and go shopping, or just hang out around the area, there's plenty to pick from on eating out and coffee shops, and the such, and night life looks to be abundant, so Pick this one and you cant' go wrong, you will walk away smiling at your experience. or should i say drive away! OH OH and the Restaurant-WOW! don't miss it for sure. p.s. girls make sure to bring your most hottest dress's and heels of the cutest kind, because that what all were wearing!

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: rick r
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be the the hottest spot in Dallas .There is always a line to get in the poolside area and bar,although if you are a guest you go right in.Rooms are beautiful and the staff is friendly,it has the feel of a boutique hotel but it is not small in any way.there are plenty of great restaurants tand entertainment around but it seemed like this was the place on weekends to party. its a very hip scene at night and weekends but the pool is always busy so get your spot early.if your looking for beautiful people this is the place RR

Reviews.Title: “Put a stay in "The Rock Star Suite" on your bucket list!”
Reviews.Author: B B
Reviews.Content: It was amazing! We had an intimate celebration with friends in this suite, as well as spending the night. It's the ultimate. From the skyline view from the balcony to the mind blowing decor - don't miss this one when over the top entertaining demanded in your planning. The staff is always ready and available for your requests.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny W
Reviews.Content: My friends and I came from Oklahoma inhonor of my girlfriends 30th birthday! I had stayed in the area at the Stoneleigh and I had heard great things about ZaZa. The service was fabulous right as we got to the hotel. The front desk was super friendly, we had help with our bags, and everything was super quick and flawless for checking in. The only thing that went wrong was that we had requested a balcony and we didn't get that, but we did get the Austin Powers suite instead, which was quite fun and entertaining to stay in! The Zaspa was wonderful!!! I got the rockstar stone massage and it felt amazing!!! The hotel is in a great location for walking distance or short cab ride to McKinney, where alot of bars and restaurants are! The Dragonfly was super crowded with an older crowd, we never tried to get in, but I heard you could walk right in and not wait inline if you are a guest at the hotel, which is very nice. I spotted a guy from "most elligible Dallas" the show on the Bravo channel :) The conceirge came to help us with our bags for leaving and had our car all ready to go, checkout went flawless as well. I cannot wait to go back to ZaZa for the summertime to hang at the pool!! We had a great trip and the staff could not have been any nicer!!!! For older people, it is kind of loud on the second floor, just a warning :)

Reviews.Title: “Always such a treat!”
Reviews.Author: Katharine2810
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at ZaZa several times over the past couple months, most recently this past Friday with several friends for a moms' night away. We stayed in the Crouching Tiger (Magnificent 7 Suite) thanks to a wonderful package deal offered on their website, and couldn't have asked for a more perfect stay! The hotel is located in a fun part of Dallas with plenty to do within walking distance, but offers so much itself that you really don't have to leave. The variety of rooms offered (love the unique and spacious concept suites), the wonderful front desk and concierge staff, and the incredible food at Dragonfly really do make it more of an "experience" instead of simply a night at a hotel. Whether a fun evening with friends, a relaxing getaway with my husband, or just a night away by myself - ZaZa is always my first choice in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan77Dallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Saturday night. Great late night spot if you're into the club scene. But get ready to meet people of the "most eligible dallas" likes. Room didn't blow us away like our recent stay at the W but for $100 less it was OK. Walked across the street and had wonderful service and food at truluck's. We hear the pool is amazing but winter stay kept us from that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary R
Reviews.Content: My purpose of stay was business travel. It was my second visit to this hotel and they are fantastic! Service level of staff, decor, etc. all fantastic! Everyone must stay at this hotel while in Dallas, TX!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Valentine's trip to ZaZa”
Reviews.Author: traveler75tx
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at ZaZa and it's even better than the first time! We stayed in a Magnificent 7 suite last time which was amazing but went with a superior balcony room this time. What a great room it was! Very spacious and the balcony and view were great! We were surprised with wine, champagne and chocolate covered strawberries our first night! So nice and unexpected! We dined at Dragonfly for Valentine's dinner. It was a fixed menu and was very good. I mentioned to the bartender earlier that day that I wished there were mashed potatoes on the menu and she went to the kitchen for a minute then came back and told me just to ask for them at dinner and they would be prepared. Thank you!! We had a quick 2 day trip but was very relaxing and enjoyable. Oh yeah.... don't miss the spa! Wonderful massages! We will be back to ZaZa very soon for another quick getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Dallas favorite”
Reviews.Author: MCinAustin
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room, great bar and excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique”
Reviews.Author: PointsAddict
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! Great pool scene and numerous room designs. The food was excellent (huevos rancheros...delicious!) and the service was very friendly. I can't say anything bad about this hotel. I really liked the W Dallas Victory hotel, but this is now my new favorite place to stay in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Bachleorette Weekend”
Reviews.Author: amn3
Reviews.Content: We wanted this to be a high-engery, wonderful, "last fling before the ring" weekend and knew that the best place to make that happen would be the Hotel ZaZa. What we did not know is that we would receive such excellent service and special treatment from everyone at the ZaZa. From the Valet parking to the ZaSpa.... the upscale rooms through the restaurant and the very unique DragonFly bar... the ZaZa was the perfect spot to make our vision become a reality. You could tell that the entire staff knew we were coming and treated us in that manner. Thank you so much for your attention to all the details that made our experience unforgetable.

Reviews.Title: “What a boutique hotel should be..”
Reviews.Author: lkfrey
Reviews.Content: From the perfect downtown location...to the staff...to the rooms...to the service...we loved everything about HotelZaZa in Dallas! The architecture and design in the lobby dictate that this is not your typical hotel. Very luxurious and inviting. The hotel staff could not have been more welcoming or helpful. Loved the well appointed rooms. Everything that you need is there with comfortable beds... A nice touch....each floor has a morning beverage station for fresh hot coffee or tea. It was so nice not to have to make average coffee in the room or pay high prices for a pot of room service coffee. They think of everything..... In the lobby....delicious iced tea was available throughout the day. The location was in a perfect tony spot in Dallas. Many great restaurants are walking distance. I would highly recommend Hotel ZaZa to business or leisure travelers in Dallas. Here's hoping more of these "perfetc" boutique hotels open in other cities across the country.

Reviews.Title: “Personal service and luxury at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Sthrnfoodie
Reviews.Content: The Zaza is one of the country's best boutique hotels because of its luxurious style and service. The friendly staff goes above and beyond to accommodate your every need both great and small. The ZaSpa is a wonderful bonus to this quaint spot. I travel to Dallas at least every other month for business and a few times in between for play. Zaza is always my pick.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: summer o
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the US and this hotel ranks up there as far as hospitality, cleanliness, and all around greatness! I was very impressed with the way the staff greeted every person as they walked in and said good-bye as they left. This place is a hotel worth staying!!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome treat”
Reviews.Author: Remona M
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Zen spa room and it was awesome. I loved my time at the Za Za. Also loved the spiked hot cocoa as a welcomed treat.

Reviews.Title: “Big "D" does it right!”
Reviews.Author: texaspath
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in the Red Shoe Suite. Upon arriving..valet are eager and welcoming. The lobby and pool areas are beautiful. All help associated with the hotel are pleasant and helpful. Special shouts out to the Bartender in the pool area. Decor is plush and opulent. Very impressed with this hotel. The Red Shoe Suite was beautiful and was stocked with everything to make our stay a memorable occasion. Maybe a little pricey but they have other rooms available. This was a great stay and when in Dallas I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: val072
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved everything about this hotel. All the staff were so friendly and efficient, from check in to leaving. The room (West Indies suite) was so comfortable, spacious with large sitting area plus large balcony and furnished throughout with so much attention to detail. I loved the flickering candles throughout hotel. I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend to others as best hotel in Texas. My only complaint was that I had to leave, and hope to stay here again soon, I would love to try each of the suites as they all look so interesting and different.

Reviews.Title: “Edgy by Design”
Reviews.Author: IkoIkoAllDay
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Medusa suite -- part of our wedding anniversary trip. Appreciated the bottle of bubbly, chocolate covered strawberries (and glowing candle) upon our return to the room after dinner out on the town. Oh, and the breakfast in the dining room was on the house, too. We'd have loved it anyway: The property is sparkling clean, elegant and just edgy enough to keep the right wing crazies away (our suite had quite a bit of homoerotic and androgynous artwork ... nicely done but homophobes would freak out -- and the mini bar had an "intimacy kit" oh my!). Big private balconies but Medusa (#300 and the rooms above) balcony is right above the entrance (larger than most but less private and chilly in winter). Got a bit noisy due to late night partying rich youngster crowd that apparently frequents the bar -- but the room was equipped with a white noise "air purifier" and we slept like babies. Yes, there was an ashtray on the balcony table (and comfy chairs and a candle, too). Fabulous furnishings -- from the sheets to the bathrobes -- will please any thread count/laundry snob. No in room coffee but a "butlers pantry" on each floor with free illy coffee every morning -- and a New York Times (and Dallas Morning News, etc) to boot. Great location w/ lots of walk-to restaurants and bars (though the late night crowd was a bit raucous and young). Easy street parking (no need for valet). Dog friendly and human friendly for sure. We'll be back, ZaZa! We love you, too!

Reviews.Title: “Best wedding anniversary ever! What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: Lskjongn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so amazing. A walks distance to the West Village and the Magnolia Theatre. We ordered room service and the lamb lollipops and mac'n'cheese were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon H
Reviews.Content: Once again ZaZa never disappoints. What a wonderful experience from the start of our stay until check out. Reservation Manager John Martin is the absolute best. Efficient, professional, accommodating - ZaZa is lucky to have him. At check in Shaun and Michael were welcoming and fun. Every ZaZa employee was attentive and friendly. The Last Czar Suite was amazing - totally luxurious. From linens to bath products this boutique hotel has only the best. Obviously the management plays a vital role with motivating employees and holding high standards in superior customer service. We live in Dallas but stay at ZaZa to celebrate special occasions - we don't even entertain other hotel options. Keep up the excellent work!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jackeemd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night the week of 11/14/11. I wish I was staying longer. I got really lucky the night I checked in. There was a corporate meeting being held at the hotel and they needed my room. I was upgraded to one of the Magnificent Seven rooms, the #1 (Leonardo). Needless to say, this was the biggest hotel room I ever stayed in. It was 1300 sq ft! Full kitchen, dining room table for 10, balcony, walk in closetâ€¦unbelievable! Everyone was so nice here, I wish I had stayed longer in that wonderful room. The next time Iâ€™m in Dallas, Iâ€™m staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in the most beautiful and original setting”
Reviews.Author: ClientServiceExpert
Reviews.Content: This is a very special hotel. Very exclusive but cozy at the same time. The design of everything â€“ rooms, lobby, entrance, even our meeting room was so extraordinary original and beautiful that staying here made extreme pleasure. You feel luxury and attention to detail in everything, yet without any arrogance. Food was great and beautifully presented. Pictures hanging in the restaurant make very upscale and warm atmosphere that it feels good to start a day with a breakfast there. Entrance to hotel is small but very luxurious. Room decorated amazingly, apparently with every detail taken care of, including inside the bathroom. Reception: fast, efficient, helpful and extremely friendly and with sense of humor. Location not bad as it is very close to a great shopping center. This is probably one of the most beautiful hotels I ever stayed. I did not want to leave it. I was here on business. This is really not the place to stay for business (because you are distracted by the beauty of the hotel and its interiors), better to come to relax with your spouse/partner.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Emily”
Reviews.Author: tonka t
Reviews.Content: I had a particularly rough day and Emily at the front desk was wonderful! She is very customer focused and even provided me with a card for a free drink at Dragonfly. Many thanks to her...an asset to your property. 1,000 "thank you's" to her.

Reviews.Title: “Great With The Gimmicks But Service Basics Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Steven0405
Reviews.Content: Great Uptown location, comfortable guest room. perfect hotel breakfast, but the hotel basics don't exist. Asked the front desk where I could grab a quick cup of coffee other than Starbucks and not in the hotel and received confused blank stares... then response: "I think there is a Starbucks across the street." Asked how far a specific hotel was from the Zaza... Doorman: "five blocks." Front desk: "A few miles." (Doorman was correct) Called the front desk to ask how to use the A/C in the room. Was told "I will send engineering right up." I replied that might not be anything wrong, but was clear that front desk unfamiliar with how to use the controls. Internet in my room never worked during my entire stay. Had no feeling of confidence it was being addressed and followed up. Clock in guest room was not set close to correct time. Hotel told me that swimming pool open year round. When I arrived was told pool closed for the season because it is not heated. Front desk at check in; constant phone interruptions and interruptions by other desk clerks. Guest checking in should be given some attention, no mention of spa or any other hotel services. When I called valet for my car; rang to front desk. Was told to call valet; I explained I did call valut and call transferred to front desk. Was told "I will try to find someone at valet." Rather than I will retrieve your car. Too bad the basics are not being addressed at ZaZa Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “perfection, I never stay anywhere else in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: james s
Reviews.Content: Thanks again for an amazing stay, the rockstar suite upgrade was RAD i love you too zaza

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Zaza - Gives that Fun, Sophisticated Feel to a Weekend Destination”
Reviews.Author: HeatherDavisOKC
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zaza in Dallas is comfortable yet chic. We love the boutique hotel if the amenities are there. ZaZa pulls this off better than others. The hotel rooms are very comfortable and plush, the Dragonfly restaurant is delicious, and the pool area is very intimate and fun. A great place to have a drink and have a romantic night or evening out with friends. This hotel is a real hotspot on special occasion nights. We have stayed in the Red Shoes suite, and it was amazing. I could have lived there permanently. :) The standard rooms are great too, just smaller but great sized. One Christmas Eve, we met our Houston family there and had Christmas dinner in the private dining room at ZaZa. It was a very memorable night with great food and wine.

Reviews.Title: “top notch”
Reviews.Author: tim n
Reviews.Content: Brice amazed us with his help in finding a baby boutique for a present purchase. Very unexpected advise from a young single man. He was very friendly and helpful. Hakam always made us feel as if we were returning home as he took care of our car and one evening removed an unruly drunk women from our presence. Very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Wetravelthere
Reviews.Content: Great room and nice location. If you are looking for something a little different. Try this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Girls getaway at Zaza”
Reviews.Author: AP_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: Some friends from near and far decided to celebrate a girlfriend's bachelorette by staying at Zaza and going out on the town in Dallas... loved the stay and hotel!! Check in was a breeze - the front desk staff was very nice and was able to check us in to one of our rooms a little early which was appreciated. I also commented on the front desk staffs outfits...they were wearing black suits with bright pink converse. They said it was for breast cancer awareness. Decor in the lobby and rooms is stylish and chic and the rooms were spacious. We had two rooms - one was a normal double, the other a suite. The pool and hotel bar had music playing and it was a lively scene. Unfortunately, the pool was already closed...one of the front desk people said that it closes when winter starts or after the Texas vs. OSU game....???!!! I quickly learned that life in texas seem to revolve around football. We also visited the little art gallery and the girl that worked there was fantastic. She took the time to explain all of the different pieces with us and was very knowledgeable. Another thing that was great was the hotels proximity to restaurants and bars. We walked everywhere that evening. This is a great place to stay if you're visiting Dallas for a weekend out on the town! One negative but i think this is the case for most hotels - Parking $24 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: Runnin26
Reviews.Content: Booked room online, confirmed with hotel. 2 days later, I receive a call saying the rate posted online was a mistake and they would not honor it. But they would upgrade me to a suite for an additional 150 bucks a night per John Martin. Otherwise, I would have no room at all. It feels like typical bait & switch operation. I should have listened to the many poor reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures”
Reviews.Author: Elias M
Reviews.Content: There was a larger guy who wore a white shirt and had longer hair tied back in a ponytail (worked by the pool/ Sunday brunch) who was so nice and agreed to take several pictures of us both Friday and Saturday. I'm sure they get that a lot but the enthusiasm was appreciated

Reviews.Title: “Best Girls Night Out!”
Reviews.Author: Sweet J
Reviews.Content: So I definitely LOVE this Hotel! My friends and I came here for a mini vacation and I have to say it was the best the bar was the best, it was by the pool, there was great drink and the music was great! I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and attractive hotel. The noise from the pool bar was the only downside.”
Reviews.Author: CRCaldwell
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, clean and stylish. The hotel has a funky vibe that works. Our only major issue was the noise from the pool bar. The music was cranked till 1AM and was very loud in our even numbered room. If you are there for the bar scene then it is likely not an issue. If you want to sleep before 1 am, bring ear plugs or get an odd numbered room on the opposite side of the hotel from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Not gaga for zaza”
Reviews.Author: scanetta
Reviews.Content: The Hotel ZaZa is a great place to stay if you are 20 years old and a valley girl. The staff (valet and service employees) couldn't be nicer. They will go out of their way for you - coffee on the floor, chocolates on the bed, and a ride to another location. The front desk staff cannot get out of their own way. They are too cool to be courteous, too cute to be of any assistance and a little too out there to provide you with what you need. The hotel is nice, food is not great, and pool is only for drinking and at all hours of the night. This is a nice hotel if you want to pretend you have money and class. For those that really have it ----- stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Always great to stay here”
Reviews.Author: HeatherLvs F
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here at Hotel ZaZa and I am so looking forward for my next stay here. Every one is very nice they assist your needs fast and they are all very professional. I don't remember his name but he works as a valet, he was very helpful and such a nice guy.

Reviews.Title: “ZZIP - that's Zaza VIP”
Reviews.Author: luxurymiami
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Dallas, Zaza is the place to stay. High end, hip, elegant, sexy, thrilling would be the words I would use to describe it. Location, Quality, Service - all the way. Along with the luxurious rooms, Zaza has Concept Suites and Magnificent 7 suites - all uniquely decorated unlike anything I've seen (and I have been to quite a lot high end hotels). We had an Out-Of-Africa Suite and it felt like we entered another world once the door closed behind us. Bedding (sheets of at least 600 counts), furniture, amenities were great. Service at teh Front Desk, Valet - same. Location is amazing - steps from McKinney street with all the bars and fancy restaurants, close to West Village, Downtown and on the line of McKinney tramway (that rides for free around Uptown) And yes - ZZIP is their loyalty program for VIPs, I just love teh way it sounds.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - great stay”
Reviews.Author: JackPriceii
Reviews.Content: This is a sweet place. As others have mentioned it is a little oasis from the city surrounding it. The decor is blend of upscale and trendy. The rooms are spacious, yet cozy. Even the hallways have been thoughfully designed and decorated with care to give you that feeling of your own space. The only bad part was our trip was too short.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay place !!!”
Reviews.Author: MECMilford
Reviews.Content: Superior service beautiful accominadations. Fun bar and very nice food.

Reviews.Title: “za za za zoom”
Reviews.Author: getupandgonow
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about fabulous ZaZa. My husband and I have spent many wonderful evenings here and would be disappointed if we had to stay elsewhere while visiting Dallas. The rooms are lush, plush, cushy and sexy. The hotel is pet-friendly, making our boxer a regular guest, as well. If you mind listening to the spill-over of noise created by guests who have overindulged in the popular hot-spot bar downstairs, don't stay here; then there will be more room for us! This is the one hotel I can say a few interruptions in sleep are worth tolerating. More than a hotel - it's truly an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: neworleanstravelers2
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at ZAZA on seven occasions and will be back for more. Truly a boutique, I would not recommend for families or crabby old people. The staff is fabulous, the rooms are beautiful, but don't go if you dislike seeing young beautiful people, listening to music, and having a good time. My wife and I evacuated there in 2005 and the staff was wonderful to us. Go, stay and have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Time to getaway”
Reviews.Author: Candy H
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service and staff. We celebrated a birthday and were treated like the celebs that we think we are. Zaza is now our place to be when in Dallas. I cannot speak high enough of how great our experience was. We have already recommend to friends, family and corporate offices.

Reviews.Title: “Za-blah”
Reviews.Author: kmfrioux
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, this is my first ever boutique hotel experience. My lack of knowledge in boutique hotels could have alot to do with my review. Front desk and staff were exceptional. The cheese and cracker tray delivered to you room was a great touch. Parking, well... There is none unless you valet for 24 dollars a day or park you car on the street (if you can find one). No store, or shop, only options is getting things out of your mini bar, 4 dollars for a can soda. This hotel has a night club attached to the pool, so if your going to the hotel for relaxation, not such a great idea. At night, it is a local club with girls in there short skirts and 7 inch heels prancing aroung the bar and pool area. No hot tub. If your thinking of staying with family, not the hotel, if your going to party.... Perfect. Housekeeping was great the first 2 days, then last 2, you couldn't even tell they were there. The rooms all in all aren't much better than a Marriott or holiday inn, now they do have a sofa, and I stayed in a regular rooms. We did ask to check out the magnificent 7 hotels, are were shown about 4 of those, and they were super nice. All in all, it was an okay experience for a 20 something non party girl and her mom, but next time I'm in Dallas, I won't stay at zaza.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Julia J
Reviews.Content: My overall experience here was exceptional! I LOVE the decor and the attention to detail! As an interior designer, I was simply marveled by the details and thought put into every little thing. That made my stay here very exciting and unique. Jason the valet guy he was so friendly and very helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Road Trip to Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy H
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided to go on a road trip from our home California to Texas. We booked our stay at Hotel ZaZa. The hotel was beautiful and just the right size. We especially enjoyed the photographs on the walls, the rooms were spacious, and oh my god the bed was exceptionally comfortable (after driving hours in a small car). The staff and service was outstanding everyone was really nice, friendly and had very good customer service. We loved our stay and hated that we had to leave. We will for sure be back here to Hotel ZaZa on our next road trip to Dallas. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: brenda b
Reviews.Content: I came here to Dallas from out of state for my husband and I's anniversary. We picked Hotel ZaZa off the great reviews. The staff from check in to departure were great. I was given a weekend rate which lower the cost of my stay. We were driven to dinner and picked up, and when we came back from our dinner date I had no idea my husband had asked the staff to do a special chore for him. When we arrived there was lit candles, chocolate covered strawberries, and rose petals in our room. In the morning they even brought us breakfast to our room. The whole experience was great! Thanks for the great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: toddOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Hotel Za Za was outstanding... Unbelievable service, great decor, awesome location... No kids and no stiffs. I f you are looking for a hotel that provides a unique experience this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Girl's Weekend”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaPrettyKitty
Reviews.Content: My BFF and I stayed at ZaZa this past weekend. Although we had plans to fry our skin at the pool all weekend, the weather had other plans so we spent most of the day at Northpark. Ha. This was our first experience at ZaZa and we weren't disappointed. The staff was ultra friendly and our room was beautiful. Despite booking our room at a discounted rate on Gilt, we received a room with a great view. The bed was so comfortable - I did not want to get out of it. Surprisingly, the room service menu was not overpriced and the spa treatments were not overpriced either and the mini bar was affordable. Just a few notes - this hotel does have a party atmosphere. It is well insulated so we didn't hear a lot of noise - in fact, what woke us up (twice) was security issuing warnings to the room across from us. We never heard a peep out of that particular room so I am not sure what the deal was. I did appreciate, though, that security was quick to take care of "problem" rooms. My only real issue with the hotel was the bathroom. I am a total bathroom snob - considering the decor of the room and the reputation of the hotel, I really thought the bathroom needed a significant upgrade. Our room had a teeny, tiny tub - I am five feet, two inches and 100 pounds - the tub was too small for me. Most people would not use a tub like that - why not take the tubs out and instead, install a glassed in shower? This also gets rid of the nasty shower curtain. We do plan to return again so we can take full advantage of the hotel's amenities. I would not pay full price for a room at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: CharlieTuna1951
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful, a fantastic experience. It is beautiful boutique hotel with great service and wonderful ambience. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Za ZA-licious”
Reviews.Author: NEW71
Reviews.Content: Hotel ZaZa is definitely an experience! Friendly staff, great location, and the most comfortable bed ever! The room service was reasonable and good. This isn't a family friendly hotel but it is perfect for a girls trip, or a get-away. It's within walking distance of excellent restaurants and with a rental car easily accessible to everything. I highly recommend this over the top, ZaZa ZOOM TRULY TEXAS experience! The bar is definitely cool, hip, a fun "SCENE" on the weekends but Fearing's at the Ritz, Truluck and several other places are within walking distance (even in heels) for a calmer crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a Rock Star”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinGorilla
Reviews.Content: This is a 5-star hotel that has theme rooms. The rooms are design by theme like the far east, Austin powers, rock star, ect. The rooms are very roomy compared to most hotels. Most rooms have a balcony for smokers. Every room comes with bath robs to walk around with in the morning which we seen people wear for morning coffee and smoking. The pool is small but gets pack with 40 to 50 people so come early or reserve a table by buying a bottle. The Bar at the pool is great with 3 bartenders easy on the eyes that take bar and food orders. The service was great at the front desk. One example is that I got up at 5am to workout and free coffee on each floor does not come to 6am. The night manager went and got me coffee on a silver planter. We also were checked in at the front desk less than a minute and greeted at the front door. For work out freaks there is a gold's gym an half block away that you can use with your hotel key or just use the hotel gym for a mild workout. I needed to work out due to the fact that the food at the dragonfly(hotel restaurant) was out of this world. Great cooks and wait staff every night. The dragonfly manager name is chaz. He made our dining experience rememberable. I notice he helped out two guest with problems and throw in free beach balls into the pool. The hotel attracts couples and singles from 25 to 50 yrs old. We didn't see one kid at the hotel but its pet friendly and notice two people with small dogs. The hotel has two vehicle that will take you anywhere with in 5 miles. There is bar and restaurant area that is a block away that has a free trolley that goes up and down the street. The gingerbread house has about 70 beers on tap. This hotel is in a rich area of dallas with no crime. So walking around the hotel is safe. There is also a running trail a block from the hotel for runners. I hope this helps you in picking a hotel. If you choose this hotel you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pool and Service, but Horrible Everything Else AND a Double Bill”
Reviews.Author: Nikki55711
Reviews.Content: They switched our pre paid room. They "forgot" to deliver pieces of our luggage. The ugly bellman asked me out while I was alone in the room - CREEPY - and they double billed me for everything! (charged me for 6 drinks when we had 3, for valet for 4 cars when we had 2).

Reviews.Title: “Escape from reality.”
Reviews.Author: orendorff
Reviews.Content: Great for a weekend away from reality, plush accommodations and rock style environment. Pool is small, but you are not really there for the water.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: RS_1082
Reviews.Content: Wow, don't even know where to begin? Went to ZaZa for a quick getaway for my wife's recent birthday and we were BLOWN AWAY!! From the moment we stepped into the lobby we were completely embraced by the staff, up to the very moment we got in our car and left to drive home the following day! Not sure what you are doing with that front desk and lobby staff, but you are doing something right!! Dinner at Dragonfly - words could not do it justice! From my amazing steak, to the dessert brought to the table for my wife's birthday (without my prompting, and not to mention the beautiful amenity sent once we got back to the room from the front desk "friends" who checked us in), to the true people watching and "scene" all around, we had one of the best stays at a hotel we have ever experienced. As I travel about 85% of the year for work I encounter a lot of things, but I have to say that everything ZaZa does, they do it right! From the staff, to the beautiful rooms, the atmosphere, the food, and overall attitude...these people are doing something right! Thanks for making not only making my wife's birthday extra special, but making a true ZaZa fan out of us, our friends, and our family!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ZaZa ..... AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MalibuBarbie2011
Reviews.Content: I organized our company retreat this last week at ZaZa. WOW! Everything turned out so great. We had excellent service from the front desk staff, banquet staff, and everyone we came in contact with. The meeting room was such a nice setting for our retreat. We also utilized the spa onsite for everyone's massages. My entire staff thanked me for making all the arrangements at the hotel. I will definitely be back for personal getaways! Thanks to Marla in the sales office who did an amazing job taking care of my group!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than all the others!”
Reviews.Author: alohajja
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed one night and commented that the service was exceptional. She went on to stay at the Westin Galleria to be close to shopping and she really regrets not staying at ZaZa! I wish there was a ZaZa in Hawaii. Every stay at ZaZa has been outstanding. Their service is better than all the Four Seasons and Ritz's I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: fancynancy121
Reviews.Content: The front desk team was quick, responsive, and fun. I love staying at the ZaZa. Great staff and amazing rooms. I keep bringing new guests with me as well. Amazing job ZaZa team!!!

Reviews.Title: “Already planning to return”
Reviews.Author: wadamboy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a quick trip. The front desk staff were exceptional. They were very helpful and prepared. They recognized me by name. The registration was ready and took all of ten seconds to complete. The valet knows me and has my car waiting. I'm already planning to return on July 8, if not sooner

Reviews.Title: “Always exceed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: EricaBattes
Reviews.Content: Best staff and service !!!! I might as well move to ZaZa as much as I love it there. ZaZa has great service and employees who get what having an experience is all about.... rare group of folks who always exceed my expectations !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Y-Roc78
Reviews.Content: I only have positive things to say about Zaza. The service was excellent, the hotel was very trendy and the decor was interesting to say the least! The rooms were up to date, clean and comfortable, and the pool and bar area were very nice and even ended up being a hot spot at night. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy”
Reviews.Author: Clark086
Reviews.Content: I loved the trendy atmosphere and rich jewel tones. The location is a little bit off the beat and path but the travel time was well worth it. I generally prefer traditional accomodation but found the Hotel Zaza to be well done. Our guest room was well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel ,impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: TRENTHATER
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival Freddie and Steve in valet were helpful with our belonging as we had many,we were attending a girls nite out weekend with some other friends, Steve clued us in on the zaza mobile,telling us that if we had plans off property later that nite to check with Freddie as he would be there most of the evening,Checking in the front desk smooth as Kali an Kara were professional as well as fun,our room was well appointed, dinner in dragonfly was awesome,service was ok but we had 8 girls in our party. After dinner we were ready to see some dallas nightlife, our valet Freddie summoned another valet to'get the truck and this big black suv with longhorns on the grill pulls up ready to take us west viilage, our driver Jason tells us there is no charge when we ask him about what we owe him but we tip him 20 dollars and thank him,Later on we call the hotel and asked to be picked up, the valet said they would be there in 10 mins, right on time Jason was there,once Jason dropped us at the hotel Freddie was there to greet us back and ask how our evening went.We felt like we were the only ones staying with yall,Thank you hotel zaza for a great weekend !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Luxury Boutique Hotel for the Young Professional”
Reviews.Author: kristakiyoko
Reviews.Content: I hate hipsters, but I've fallen victim to the charm of staying in luxury boutique hotels. When my fiance and I were planning a summer trip to Dallas, a friend recommended Zaza and from the reviews online I decided it would be great. We stayed for two nights in a deluxe king room and I'd say Zaza strives to be on par with any of today's luxury boutique hotels. There's a lot that has already been said about this place, but here are my top 3 praises: 1. Fabulous staff & top notch service. The majority of the staff were all young and good looking, but they lacked the snootiness of other places (see my scathing review of the Edition in Waikiki). We just happened to be staying there right when the NBA finals were going on in Dallas (which made for fun nights out). However, despite what I assumed was a full-house, the staff never made us feel rushed or unwanted. Thank you! 2. The courtesy hotel shuttle. They have at least 2 shuttles on hand (if not more), so we never had to wait for a FREE shuttle to return. On top of that, the shuttle drivers had tons of fabulous suggestions for places to see, eat, and drink. 3. Dragonfly and poolside dining. The pool and dragonfly restaurant provided much needed reprieve from the 100 degree weather. I expected the restaurant to be pricey, but was surprised by their VERY reasonable prices. We had lunch there and I had the ahi tacos (tasty) for $10 and my fiance ordered a BLT (also only $10). Although tiny, the restaurant/bar is a vibrant little space decorated for my hidden hipster. 4. I know I said top 3, but I must mention that the pressure from the shower head was amazing. I don't think I've had that great of a shower in any hotel before. I don't have any real criticisms of the hotel. However, I am a 20-something young professional so I think this place was more suited to my style than a family with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “It's Fun Staying ZaZa!”
Reviews.Author: trtzw
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience. Very hip, there is something unique, quirky and interesting to see in every place you look. The room, Club ZaZa Superior King, was quite comfortable. The restaurant, Dragonfly, had an outstanding menu and very attentive service. The pool area and outdoor bar is great for people watching. Our business meetings were held in the ZaZa Social Houseâ€”which was a unique space, a former storefront now an art gallery. When in Dallas, make it a point to stay ZaZa!

Reviews.Title: “Second To None!”
Reviews.Author: DellFry
Reviews.Content: The following staff members are key to my continuous returns to ZaZA. Matt and Camille at front desk and max at dragonfly are stellar! Their service is second to none!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, Price is not”
Reviews.Author: Selfcentor
Reviews.Content: My gf got us one night at the hotel as a suprise. The hotel and atmosphere was amazing. The club can be loud but we had a balcony room which over looked it and we were pre warned! We wanted the music so did not bother us! BTW the club was great with great music! Dinner at Dragon fly was very good. Con..Had reservations and still had to wait 30 min. Room was large and very nice. A big con was before checking in my GF noticed it said two double beds and she had reserved a king. Called and they said that ment nothing and we had a king. She insisted on what it said. They again said no you will have a king. When we got to our room it was two full beds! Granted we still made it work but the issue is she asked twice about it! Over all a cool and fun hotel. Noise does travel through the walls but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel- Horrendous service.”
Reviews.Author: kristi34607
Reviews.Content: The good: very chic hotel. great location within walking distance to restaurants & bars. good onsite restaurant and bar. Rooms are spacious. The bad: The pool, bar & restaurant area turns into a club at night, It is definitely a party hotel and it is VERY loud. If you're looking for a party hotel, Za Za will work for you, but if you're a light sleeper or want a more relaxing time, I'd be wary. The ugly: The service was simply awful. We had reserved 2 rooms- 1 for 3 nights and the 2nd for 2 nights. They couldn't find the 2nd reservation. Even with my printed confirmation from Jetsetter, it was still a hassle. OK, these sorts of things happen, but the people at the front desk were so unbelievably rude about it. Apparently, I was causing them a tremendous inconvenience to give us our 2nd (and PREPAID) room. They also have a complimentary shuttle- in theory. We called down to the valet stand to ask if they would take us to a specific area. They said yes, and recommended a time to leave to avoid rush hour traffic. When we went downstairs, they told us the destination was too far (I got 3 different mileage requirements over the course if our stay) and we would have to take a taxi. When I explained that we had been told differently on the phone, the valet was extremely rude (again) and kept questioning me with the implication that we were lying! Lastly, we had some questionable charges on our bill at check out. There were charges showing up as "room service charges" when we had never ordered room service. It turned out that they were bar charges that were classified incorrectly, but I felt justified in questioning it since the descriptions were unclear. Furthermore, our waitress at the bar the previous evening had simply disappeared and I couldn't find her to sign my bill. So I wanted to be sure we were not overcharged. Again, the woman at the desk was beyond rude. It was pretty much the last straw. The whole thing really put a damper on our girls weekend. And I was pretty appalled that a hotel billed as 4 star would have such terrible service. I know we'll never go back nor would I recommend Za Za to anyone visiting Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: wrileytaylor
Reviews.Content: I have always loved Hotel Zaza in Houston. It's location and design have been very friendly and inviting. The pool and ZaSpa are both relaxing as well. However, when I decided to stay at Hotel Zaza in Dallas, I was disappointed that it felt more like a club than a luxury hotel. Also, the pool wasn't very private or relaxing being practically in the restaurant (which was very good and better than Monarch). The lobby was small and nothing like Houston's and it wasn't very inviting when I arrived back at the hotel after going out only to be greeted by a fully lit entrance. I was surprised, because I figured Dallas was all about looks and the Houston hotel turned out to be a lot nicer. The rooms, however, were just as nice and I loved the Calamari Salad from Dragonfly.

Reviews.Title: “Overdone w/ Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler5589
Reviews.Content: Judging by the disparity in reviews of this hotel, I guess it really depends what you are looking for in a hotel. If you want poor, dismissive serivce, and a "see and be seen" atmosphere, this place is for you. The service was horrible - from leaving our luggage in the lobby (and then we had to go get it ourselves and bring it to our room), to the front desk staff acting like we were bothering them, to be overcharged on the bill (and not resolving it). If you want to take your shirt off and be seen by the pool, by all means, this is your spot. If you want customer service, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Overly Pretentious- Lacking Quality”
Reviews.Author: Frustrated2011
Reviews.Content: Overly pretentious hotel apparently managed by young untrained kids-sorely lacking professionalism. Entire visit was a total calamity of fumblings from mis-representing the type of room thru reservations to the front desk breeching our confidentiality and personal information to not allowing us to check in on time causing lengthy unecessary delays in our planned events to losing our belongings upon check in to Guest Services promising everything and not delivering to the valet placing dripping flower water vases on the leather seats of our Mercedes. Entire stay was a relentless battle for basic services. TERRIBLE WASTE OF $$$ !

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: sophiedelt
Reviews.Content: Wow! This hotel is amazing! I come here everytime I'm in Dallas & it never dissapoints. The decor is amazing as well as the location. Its a wonderful experience and I suggest you check it out any time you are in the area and want to feel luxurious!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: MalibuMinded
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Zaza many times over the years in Dallas and it is still my favorite hotel! Great service, really fun bar, fabulous restaurant, pool is small but cool, spa is small but sufficient for a basic "tune up" and the staff is always great even when they are the it place to be and slammed. Just do it!

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel! highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mbellantone
Reviews.Content: Apart from the fact that it sits in Dallas, one of the dullest cities I have ever seen, this hotel is simply wonderful. And many thanks to the staff there who work to the highest standards of service!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was a mess and staff was not helpful”
Reviews.Author: jm6605
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel friday hoping for a nice relaxing weekend. We noticed the hotel was a little busy but did not let it get to us. The first night about 2am we were awaken by a girl banging on the door next to us and we called security. they arrived and did not make the girl stop at first however after i opened the door and asked them to make her stop they did but allowed her to call in the hall way to her friends. she was not a guest of the hotel but wanted to crash with friends and was trying to call them. Saturday night there was a weeding and a party downstairs we left for dinner and when we came back we learned there had been a big fight. we kept to ourselves and tried to get back to our room but were told we have to wait. security thought we were with the party. after several attempts to show them we were not they finally let us in. once upstairs we had to leave again to get away from the partys in the room accross from us. we went down stairs to talk to the front desk and they already knew about it but have not done anything for it. That night we did not get any sleep until 4am when the music cut off and they left.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed at during a business trip!”
Reviews.Author: thisdivaluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: I loved, loved this hotel! Very ecletic and so unsual. A breath of fresh air. Nice to stay someplace that offered something different than your typical "business" stay hotel. Loved hearing some of my conservative collegues' reaction to the art in the ladies bathroom, LOL! Ran into Eddie van Helen in the elevator. The VIP suite, loved it, even though I wasn't staying there! One of 2 best hotels I have stayed at during a business trip! My only complaint, was the cook...my filet mignon was rare and not medium well. tried to send it back, but was told the wait would be an additional 30 minutes. Only ate a salad and dessert that night. Billing was off too, but after a phone call was resolved. Also, the pool was closed and converted to a dance floor. Made for a very nice company pic.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: sushifan37
Reviews.Content: This frankly is one amazing hotel. Upscale and for the true hotel affiecendo. Just blocks away from Dallas main strip for nightlife (and trust me, Dallas has quite the nightlife ). It seems like anyone who's who in Dallas will be sitting in one of the three hotel's lounges, the hotel is a symbol of 60's decadence. Everything is luxury and diffently this all comes with a hefty price tag (you can find some special rates online though). If your going to Dallas for business impress your clients with the great dinner at the 5 star restaurant located within or even around the hotel. For those of you wanting to shake your tail feather, Hotel Zaza is a party every Friday and Saturday night. The "locals" won't be caught dead there but if your an aristocrat, this is your place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing hotel I've been to!”
Reviews.Author: LLMonks
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend recently stayed at Zaza to celebrate our anniversary and I cannot tell you a better place to stay in Texas than this boutique hotel. The art the experience the atmosphere cannot be beat. We had dinner and drinks at the Dragonfly restaurant and the food was absolutely impeccable. The service both at the restaurant and hotel was stellar and could not have made our stay more memorable. We may have to make another trip to Dallas just to stay here! This place is a unforgettable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Yuck. Save your money and go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Denisetx
Reviews.Content: We stayed last weekend and was this hotel not what I expected. Hideous. We were in room 233. Bare bones room. Not even a real comforter on the bed. I froze! Mattress was old and saggy. If you love the smell of cigarette smoke in your room, get room 233. Disgusting. When you walk in the door of the hotel the smoke smell just overpowers you. And the kicker- We got home and were double charge on our Debit card. Call the hotel and they said "All Requst must be in writing". What the heck? Horrible Service. I guess if you are in the party drinking crowd and want to get your drink on, pick up the ladies/men and need a place to hook up-This may be the hotel for you. What a dump. Stay at the Ritz, Mansion, Adolphus, or Joule.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: msblmurphy
Reviews.Content: As frequent guests of this hotel, we probably stay there 10-12 times a year, our last 3 trips have gone from bad to worse. This past stay, when we checked in our room there was a dead roach on the floor. We walked downstairs to the front desk on our way to dinner and asked the person working the desk to please send someone up to our room to clean it up while we were gone. This did not happen, when we got back to the room 5 hours later, it was still there and was never picked up. At the bar downstairs, we waited in long lines for drinks due to the fact that there were not enough bar tenders. When we finally were able to get service, the bar tenders were rude and seemed like we were imposing on them to order our drinks. At breakfast the next morning at the Dragonfly, their restaurant, our order was completely forgotten even after asking our waiter several times to check on it. Our waiter dropped off another table's ticket for us to pay and we could not find him to have him change it, so we had to stop a manager. All in all, we used to love this place and raved about it to all of our friends. Now it seems they are more interested in becoming a hot spot for the 20s scence and no longer interested in great service and experience. For close to $500 a night there are much better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “The ZaZa exceeded my expectations and my expectations were high!”
Reviews.Author: Woody066
Reviews.Content: The room was perfect and decorated with the special ZaZa touch. I am a photographer and always love coming to the ZaZa to see the photos. We had two great meals at the hotel and hung out at the bar until 130 am, our favorite was the ZaZa lemonade. Staff is courteous and always helpful. In the summer the pool area is one of the best places in Houston to relax and soak up the sun. The location is in the middle of Houston's museum district and right next to Herman Park - you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ZaZa Dallas New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: texastourist
Reviews.Content: Booked a New Years Eve package for myself and my date that included a room on the 3rd floor, 311 to be exact and were accomponied by some friends who stayed across the hall in room 312 with a nice balcony view overlooking the pool area where the party was to take place. We did not check in until 9pm due to driving in from out of town and eating nearby before arriving. Upon arriving it was pretty busy and the staff were doing their best, we have stayed here before and were a little let down that the check in process did no go as usual. We are used to prompt car service and luggage removal, we had to wait in line to get out of the car and had to bring in our own luggage as no one even offered to help. Check in staff were not as courteous as we have experienced as before so strike 2 already and its only been 20 minutes since we have arrived. We get to our room and it was nice as usual but I noticed how dusty the desktops and table ends are and the black couch was covered in lint and other 'stuff" that I did not even want to sit down on it. Shrugged all this off as we came to party, so we changed clothes and while in the restroom I noticed the floor of the shower was not as clean as I am used to, lots of soap scum on the floor and I notice some of the tile work starting to crack plus the door handle to the bathroom was coming loose (I fixed that). Get down to the New Years Eve party, security was great checking everyone for arm bands and proper dress attire they were on their A game that night so kudos to them, however the bartenders although overwhelmed and understaffed were plain RUDE especially the femal bartender in the first bar to the right when you came in, owning a bar back where we live I understand the stress they get when it gets super crazy busy but there is no room for rudeness as if this happened at my bar she would of been let go the next day but we didn't let them ruin our night the party was a blast we had our fair share of spirits and toasted in a New Year in style. Next morning get up around 9am of course not feeling the best and looking forward to a nice hot shower, turn on the shower and notice the shower head is broken the center ring is loose and water is shooting out the back, side and front of the shower head I didn't feel so hot so calling the front dest for a new shower head was not in the cards, however this was so bad this had to of been an problem from the previous guest or at least house cleaning should of caught this so staff needs to replace the shower head on room 311, thanks!!! We get all cleaned up go down to eat breakfast place our order and then move tables to accomodate our friends who came down from their room, now at this point it's been close to 30 minutes since we place our order of pancakes and waffles whish is pretty basic, another 15 minutes go by and we had to waive down the only waiter that seemed to be happy he is there and he goes back and says it's coming right out, another 10 minutes go by and he finally brings our food and apologizes and explains they simply screwed up and I appreciated his honesty much better than a lame excuse. My date goes to take a drink out of her glass of Dr.Pepper and there is a milk carton top and the plastic security strip IN HER GLASS!!! Yes in her glass, we waived down the waiter again and explain what is going on and I can tell he is just like kill me now but again offers a sincere apology and quickly replaces it with a fresh glass and soda, we eat then check out. Overall we had fun, but were let down by a few things I never expected from this hotel, less than adequate cleanliness, hotel staff rudeness, poor car service which I chalk up to the New Years Eve event, rude bartenders due to their stress and understaffing and the hour and half breakfast for simple food. I know alot was going on that weekend but this should of been taken in account for and staffed properly, I left my bar in good hands and properly staffed before coming to Dallas and it worked beautifully hopefully ZaZa won't let us down in the future as we love coming here.

Reviews.Title: “The place looks nice but the service is terrible”
Reviews.Author: ejhWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We had trouble with non-functional toilet, safety deposit box and air-conditioning. Staff was indifferent and were only interested in socializing with each other. After returning home we wrote to the "manager" to describe our very disappointed stay. We didn't get any reply. On duty managers were irresponsible and discourteous. To add to the uncomfortable stay we were charged for items that we did not use.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service!”
Reviews.Author: XxoticTravel
Reviews.Content: I am a Travel Agent with Xxotic Travel based in Dallas, TX had a client who email me his reviews regarding his stay, and he stated the service he received was beyond great! Everything was ready once he arrived, room service was exact with their timing, and he plans to stay at this hotel the next time he comes into town for business! Traveling soon? Email us at XxoticTravel@live.com with all of your travel needs, let us save you the time and hassel of searching online for that perfect flight!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: mharlin
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay at the Zaza. I highly recommend it if you are looking for a luxurious room with great linens and ammenities. It is also within walking distance of some of the hottest restaurants and nightlife in Dallas! The spa was amazing. Matthew was a wonderful masseuse! The staff at the hotel has always been SO accomodating. We had a "minor emergency" and Dustin Merritt came to our rescue! We greatly appreciated his help!! Sincerely, Trey and Melody Harlin

Reviews.Title: “Rock Star Hot!”
Reviews.Author: Saberhunt
Reviews.Content: High-end luxury at it's best! This oasis offers: cutting edge design, exotic themes throughout and superior service. If staying in one of the "concept suites" or in one of the "magnificent seven" be prepared to make a mortgage payment (or higher) each night stayed..... High priced hotel but if you want a treat - this is the answer! The standard rooms are more reasonable in nightly rate. While they are not as roomy or unique as the others mentioned, they are above average and as I mentioned - less expensive while still set in the glamorous surroundings of Hotel ZaZa! In a word, Hotel ZaZa is IMPRESSIVE to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Shag-a-Delic Suite - Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Lader0
Reviews.Content: Shag-a-Delic Suite was incredible! Staff was exceptional as always. Great location in Downtown Dallas, and the people watching... too much fun.

Reviews.Title: “This place is run by Henchmen. TERRIBLE customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: AustinAussie
Reviews.Content: We had such high expectations of our stay at Zaza for my 20th year high school reunion. While the property is ideally situated and our balcony room was spacious and tastefully done, the surly security staff put a damper on our visit and as a result, I won't ever return. About an hour after we checked in and after I had left for my reunion dinner, my husband stopped at the convenience store across the street for some of his favorite Belgian beers as ZaZa carried less than stellar brands and was QUESTIONED and searched by security while re-entering the property. My husband was properly dressed and groomed and had just been greeted by security before he crossed the street to go the store. It was truly a bizzare spectacle and a mere taste of what was to follow. I was so incensed by this that I called the hotel from my reunion and the operator acknowledged that outside alcohol was prohibited but that security should not have behaved so brusquely to my husband. I suggested that they mention this policy to their guests at check in as I had just witnessed some young women bringing in a bottle of wine with them at check in. That night we were kept awake until after 2am by the nightclub scene congregating around the pool below our room, but we understood that Zaza has a very Vegas like atmosphere and left it at that and enjoyed watching the scene from our balcony. However, the following night a group of us were gathering in one of our rooms following our reunion in ZaZaâ€™s ballroom and were having fun catching up after all these years when security pounded on the door and demanded everyone leave the room. There were 8 of us in a double room at the time. My husband pointed out to them that we were all guests, there was more noise being made below at the pool and just about every other room in the hotel was throbbing with noise and music. The security thugs insisted we leave. I admit my husband was rather annoyed by their surly attitude and let them know it, but we returned to our room and while we were readying for bed the director of security pounded on our door. When I peered through the peep hole, security said they would call the police if we didn't open the door. Really? We are bunch of 30 somethings getting together for a reunion and we have spent thousands of dollars over two days in their establishment and they treat their guests like that? The whole situation was a travesty. When we asked why they were bothering us in our room they said " This is MY hotel and we got a call that you was making noise up in here all night so weâ€™re coming to investigate". We explained that we had been out of our room until this point. When I called the front desk, they confirmed that security were actually mad at my husband for getting upset when they came to our friend's room. How ridiculous! We did not deface any property and were far less loud than several other guestrooms including the cacophony by the pool. Quite simply the thugs they hire for security have power trips and no concept of customer service. Meanwhile my husband and I couldn't get rest due to the thumping rap music from the room next to us. We called to complain and nothing was done. I mentioned again to the front desk at checkout how disappointed we were with their terrible security guards and their brutish behavior only to be met with a shrug and was told â€œWell hopefully you enjoyed your stay until that pointâ€�. That was the worst $1200 in two days I have ever spent! I was even more dismayed the following day when I found out that the security guard who caused this whole debacle eventually returned to my friendâ€™s room to hang out with them once his shift was over. My friends even sent me a video to prove it. Lo and behold, there is the security guard sitting on the couch enjoying himself with MY friends while I was too scared to leave my room due to ZaZaâ€™s intimidation tactics. What a shame for them as I could have brought them a lot more future business and referrals if they hadnâ€™t behaved like such ruffians.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: World_Hiker1969
Reviews.Content: This place is in the best part of Dallas. I am not a big fan of Dallas, but this hotel and its location made the trip fun. 1. nice rooms 2. great service 3. really funky layout throughout the hotel. It has a unique vibe that I really appreciated. 4. very good bar / restaurant -- frequented by many, not just hotel guests. the hotel is part of the city's scene.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler144
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ZaZa over Columbus Day weekend to celebrate my bachelorette party. The staff knew this upon reservation and were told when reserving that we wanted to reserve a room with a balcony overlooking the pool area so we could party in the room and also down by the pool. This was the key reason for booking this particular hotel. Upon arrival, we see that the pool area is under construction and would be closed for the entire weekend. No apologies were provided or sorry we are not meeting your expectations, let me offer a complimentary bottle of champagne or something. Just its closed and when inquired if this was posted for guests to see and be aware of - was told very arrogantly, its closed every year this particular weekend (like we should know that). At $500 per night, I expect a little more than attitude. So off to a very disappointing start to begin what should be a special weekend for me. Also, at check in they had glasses of complimentary champagne. Ok, that's nice. Except there were 3 of us and not much left so sorry girls, you'll have to share and by the way, one of the glasses broke and you'll just have to use it if you want any. Again, $500 a night and you can't find another glass? So rather than go to the hotel bar / pool area we headed out to uptown and had a great time. Saturday - time for an afternoon of spa treatments for me and 2 of my bridesmaids. After trying to confirm appointments all week and told the voicemail system wasn't working so even though you left a message, no one calls you back. This was for days. We walked in to confirm in person. One girl was completely left off the books for her appointments. So again, no apologies or let me see what we can do to fix this - just no she's not here. We had to purposely ask - well, can you book her in. Oh yes, certainly. What? We have to beg for this? So after getting her squared away, we leave to have lunch. Came back after lunch for our appointments and the girl who was not on the books ended up sitting in the waiting room for over a half hour because no one told the massage therapist she had an appointment so the therapist went to lunch! So her appointment being later then proceeded to make my appointment a half hour late. Which is just unprofessional at a spa of this level. And while standing in the waiting room, a therapist and the receptionist got into a huge screaming match and the therapist quit. Not something guests should have to witness. Unprofessional. The one glowing review I can provide is the bartender was very nice to our group and made me feel special for my bachelorette party. Julian - you were great. So I do think this hotel is very cool looking and the rooms are very comfortable but for the customer service we received, it is far over priced. I would have gotten better service from the Embassy Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome 30th Birthday Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: shanahd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Labor Day weekend with 4 girlfriends for a joint 30th Birthday celebration. Scheduled check in was for 3pm on Friday. One of our guests was flying in and arrived before us (her name was not on reservation); however the front desk girl worked it out and she was able to check into our rooms 2hrs early. Valet and check in went smoothly, no problems. We had 2 balcony rooms with double beds overlooking the pool area. The rooms were clean, spacious, and funky. Beds were very comfortable and the mini bar was well stocked. The bathroom was large and easily accommodated 3 girls getting dressed for a night out. While getting ready we made cocktails and needed lemons and lime, the room service staff was quick to respond, requiring little delay of our celebration. The hotel bar, by the pool, was great and the bartenders very attentive. The pool area is fairly small for as popular of a place as it is. There may be only about 30-40 lounge chairs. I made sure to wake early the next morning to ensure we had lounge chairs at the pool. I had coffee at the pool while I waited on my party to awake and join me. Around 11am the pool area started filling up, and luckily my friends had aroused from their slumber by this time to secure their lounges. By 1pm it was packed, but not in a bad way. However if you wait til 1230 or 1 to come down plan on sitting/ laying on the cement. I spent the entire day from around 930am til 430pm at the pool lounging, having cocktails (wonderful), and lunch with my girlfriends â€¦ One caveat â€“ the pool is freezing, even when it was 100F outside. But besides that the pool day was perfect! We asked the front desk the best way to get to our restaurant (cab, trolly, etc) because we werenâ€™t driving, she said the hotel has a vehicle that they would drive us. I think it was an expedition, but whatever it was it was a nice large SUV that comfortably held the 5 of us. The only fee is tipping the driver (which we tipped about $25 for a 5min ride) and then he gave us a card and told us to call when we were ready to be picked up. After dinner we called and he was there in less than 10min. Great service. That evening we had a cocktail at the pool bar before heading to dinner at Nick & Samâ€™s. We talked with the bartender who was there the night before, mentioned it was our birthday and he gave us a glass of champagne to start the celebration.
