When we told him where we were going for dinner he said a good friend of his manages over there, tell him we are friends of him blah blah blah (but who really does that, â€œHi Iâ€™m friends of bartender X and expect you to do something special for meâ€¦ ) He then said never mind and texted her right then to let her know we were coming (you never know what to expect with that type of thing). But when we got the restaurant we were seated and they brought out a round of champagne for our party of 5 and then a birthday card addressed to me and the other birthday girl. Just a very nice personal touch that I applaud ZaZa staff and Nick & Samâ€™s for. Little things can truly make or break a moment. Rest of the evening at ZaZa was spent with a Tarot card reader who they have come about 2 times a month. I highly suggest it, different and much fun for a group of girls. We checked out about 11am on Sunday and had an amazing time. Suggest staying here for any time you want to relax and let go.

Reviews.Title: “ZaZa.....”
Reviews.Author: ilovemygsd
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at Hotel ZaZa for a Girls' Weekend. We had a great time. The hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful. We used the spa and thoroughly enjoyed it. Our room was very large and clean and they upgraded us to a balcony room. The balcony overlooked the pool area. At night, it was very loud, but we were able to get to sleep without major issues. The halls are somewhat dark and the elevator is extremely dark. I wouldn't have felt comfortable there if I had been alone. The location is a great and there is a great cupcake place across the street. You can take the trolley down to the West Village as well. We didn't have a car, so the parking fees weren't an issue for us. We loved the ZaZa and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “ouch - creative people not welcomed”
Reviews.Author: sethstein
Reviews.Content: Booked through Tablet Hotels, which has always led me to great, creative, boutique hotels.... but I am questioning why this hotel is considered boutique or creatives After a day of shooting a corporate film, myself and 2 others came back to the hotel with rolling bags of our gear. I was STOPPED as I was getting in the elevator by a staff member. " is that professional camera equipment?" - to which i said yes we just finished shooting for a client. to which he said.... "you cannot bring ANY professional camera gear in the hotel, you will have to leave it in your car, you cannot bring it to your room" I thought he was kidding but he was not. The situation escalated to the point where after the manager could not navigate the situation, they brought in the President of the hotel. We were asked to sign a document to state we would not shoot in their hotel. How things are handled is a reflection of management and the hotel.... And it was amateur from the bottom to the top. They handled it so poorly I will not recommend nor stay in the hotel again. There are many choices and it comes down to the smallest details. instead of interrogating us as we return from a full day out (we had all our gear with us when we checked in the day before) - they could have been gracious, civil or even courteous to a guest. Really left a bad taste in my mouth all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trendy Hotel- but c'mon the bar closes at 11?”
Reviews.Author: veganista
Reviews.Content: Was here for a work trip. My client hosted a dinner and drinks one night and an all day meeting the next. First the pros: - Free wi-fi- I did not even know that still existed in hotels - Large room- basic room was very large with sitting area, clean and great decor - Trendy feel- the entire hotel had a very cool atmosphere - Great meeting rooms- not your normal "convention" cold rooms, very warm with nice touches. - Friendly staff- Very accommodating! I needed 25 print outs and the business center was closed, front desk pulled them off my thumb drive, no problem, free of charge. - Great food- Dinner was delish, and as a vegetarian, they were very accommodating and my meal was well thought out, not an afterthought. Now the cons: - The bar closes at 11pm- we needed to entertain our guests/clients after dinner and had to walk to the nearly Ritz to do so - Hot elevator- Every time I got in the hot dark elevator I thought I was going to pass out- obviously not air conditioned and in August in Dallas when you are there for a meeting- up and down carrying stuff in a suit, this actually became very uncomfortable. - Meeting set up was slow- I arrived to set up my laptop for the day meeting and the projector and sound was still not set up. They got the projector in, but sound was still missing and this caused a serious kink to the presentations. We got it worked out, but it should have been smoother and not effected the time during the meeting. Overall I recommend this hotel and would either stay here again or the W when visiting Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “cool boutique hotel with scene and edge”
Reviews.Author: andergtr
Reviews.Content: i had a one-night trip to dallas recently and decided to check into the zaza after asking around for boutique hotel recommendations. i booked on tablethotels.com but could have booked directly on their website. check-in was good, but the attendant was a little absent-minded. i checked in around 2 pm and even though i mentioned i would be coming in earlier than the 3 pm check-in, no room was ready. like most high-end hotels, they said they would store my baggage, but they ended up just leaving it by the concierge desk instead of in a closet or storage room--disappointing, because someone could have just taken my bag. also, the attendant at check-in was supposed to call me when the room was ready, but at 3 pm i had to go to the front desk because i hadn't yet received a call, and i wanted to change and shower before my meeting at 4 pm. (it was exceedingly humid that day and it was pouring when i drove to the hotel). the room itself was nice, a corner unit with a balcony. the room had some funky touches, like a seat that said "sit on me" and a cruise-ship-like porthole window above the bed, so that if you didn't pull the drapes, the rooms across the way could probably see you doing your business. locaton was fantastic, near to everything downtown, and the downstairs lobby bar/restaurant was a scene. i had a great breakfast the next day, as well. i'll overlook the missteps at check-in. i'd be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Allegra603
Reviews.Content: Stayed here - and it couldn't have been better!! Fun atmosphere - boutique but not cliche. High end design with down to earth, friendly staff - none of that snooty attitude here (well, at least not from the staff!!) Dinner in the restaurant was delicious - not a particularly "intimate" atmophere, but a fun one to see and be seen! Hung out by the pool in the evening and it was the hip, trendy, (but secretly fun to people-watch) crowd. Would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “ZaZa is fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: HelenaLouise
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the hotel reviews, I was not sure ZaZa was the best place to surprise my husband on his 40th birthday with an overnight stay. ZaZa was a perfect choice & we loved it! The decor, photographs, artwork, our room & the spa experience were all wonderful! If you are not there to party like a rockstar, be sure to ask for a quiet room when making reservations. Upon check-in, my husband was wished a happy birthday & the associate made sure that I had truly asked for a quiet room. Our room had a comfortable, king-sized bed & sitting area. We had a couple's massage at ZaSpa which was also wonderful. I returned to our room first. The staff had drawn the curtains, lit candles & placed mints on the bed - it was so romantic and such a nice touch:-) Initially, my husband thought I did it, which was even better. We had a drink & appetizer at Dragonfly - both were very nice. If I had one complaint, it would be that I could not get cold water out of the sink in our room. Seriously, that's it... Overall - a cool, trendy place. I highly recommend ZaZa.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Amazing Adventure Awaits You!”
Reviews.Author: DaveyJones2
Reviews.Content: If you are feeling like an escape from the everyday, drab, boring, 9-5, I have the perfect place for you. Hotel ZAZA is an amazing oasis tucked away in Uptown Dallas, Texas. The staff will take your ideas for a relaxing get away, and get to work making it an event unlike anything you have ever experienced. Folks, I have been around the world, and nothing thus far has come close to the treasure that awaits you at ZAZA. The rooms make you feel Chic, yet cozy. If you have ever wanted to feel like a Rock Star, but lack any particular talent, they will bend over backwards to make you feel special. Even as I write this review, I chuckle at the good times we had during our stay. Executive Chef Morgan will tease your senses with an amazing menu. The bar is hopping with Dallas socialites, and the outside pool magically transforms into a groovy disco for adults after the sun goes down. If you book in advance, the deals get even better. There is no price on superb service, outstanding quality, and a warm smile. My stay was not one of a kind, as I am sure everyone who visits ZAZA is sure to experience the most important quality that separates the ordinary from the extraordinary; Customer Service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: PR
Reviews.Content: It was our 22nd wedding anniversary, so we decided to spend the night at Zaza. We booked their Summer package and upgraded it to a suite. We had the West Endies Suite, which was huge and very well appointed. With the suite we had 2 free drink coupons and free breakfast. I ordered spa services for my wife (scrub and massage) and she said it was the best she ever had. The hotel was really hopping and it is a great place to watch people. We hung out at the pool during the afternoon on Friday and it was quite the scene. Then after our dinner at Capital Grille, we came back and hung at the pool for a couple of hours. It was very active and a lot of fun. Breakfast the next day was great in the Dragonfly. I think that other than the W, Zaza is probably the closest to an L.A. or Vegas type of hotel scene you can find.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and splendid service!”
Reviews.Author: gleeloyd
Reviews.Content: Our only disappointment was that the Bohemian Suite was not quite what was featured in pictures on the website. But it was very, very good! Looking back now, it was only one piece of furniture and a few different pillows in the photo. We stopped in at the lounge late Saturday night after the restaurant had closed. The hostess went beyond herself to prepare a desert and fresh coffee for us! After departure, my wife discovered she had left her cell phone charger in the room. The hotel operator put us in contact with the head housekeeper who had the charger and promised to keep it at her desk until we had a chance to stop back by and retrieve it. Everyone was gracious, attentive, and met our expectations for luxury-level service. Every square foot of the property treats the visitor to a sensory experience!

Reviews.Title: “I am accustomed to speedy and precise service in every aspect of my stay -- Hotel ZaZa provided that wonderfully”
Reviews.Author: jlinowes
Reviews.Content: The car-park guys were terrific -- every one of them. They were peppy, friendly, attentive, competent, and helpful. They gave good directions to everywhere, had good suggestions for where to go, and were prompt with retrieving my car. They all take their job seriously, with an air of welcoming and helping. As a business traveler from the Northeast, I am accustomed to speedy and precise service in every aspect of my stay -- Hotel ZaZa provided that wonderfully. I hope to stay there on my next Dallas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Invasion of Privacy”
Reviews.Author: Robbinwood
Reviews.Content: After checking into the hotel my husband realized that he had left our cooler in the car. He called Valet to tell them he was coming down to get the cooler. This "valet person" asked him if the cooler has alcohol in it. My husband, an honest person said "well, yes". This "person" proceeded to tell my husband, "well, you can't bring alcohol into the hotel", Number 1, to ask a guest what's in your luggage/cooler is an envasion of privacy.....how dare they ask that question! No where on their website does it say a guest cannot bring anything they want in their cooler into their hotel. Is this a state law or something? We had about 45 minutes from the time we checked in until we left for a dinner reservation so it wasn't like we were planning a "who knows what" in our room. We simply wanted one drink before we left. Funny, when we checked out and while we were waiting for our car, Valet brought around a car for 3 girls and guess what they loaded into the back of their car.....not just a small cooler but a hugh cooler on wheels!! Wonder if they asked those girls if they had alcohol in their cooler? They have tons of girls get-to-gathers and showers and more parties that one can imagize at Hotel Zaza but this 60 + couple was made to feel like we were trying to have a orgy or something in our room. Shame on you ZAZA.

Reviews.Title: “Just Plain Cool - Not Your Father's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HungryBay
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel is very friendly. The waitstaff at Dragonfly were exceptional - made my clients feel like they were the only ones there. Rooms are very big w/ funky furnishings....not a boring old hotel room with drab carpet and cookie-cutter furniture.... Bathroom great - shower is awesome. Fitness center is top notch....Shuttle service is great to Downtown - even the shuttle is cool with steer horns on the hood. Got an upgrade once to a "Magnificent Seven" room - too bad I was by myself on business because I could have thrown a party in the room it was so big! I travel very often - This is as good as an in-town hotel gets......

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room”
Reviews.Author: Matt59
Reviews.Content: Check-in, conciege, little extras, service, etc... could use some fine-tuning. It's a mix of friendly mom/popishness and not-quite-ready-for-prime-time-players. But the room was great, especially for the price. Bed, shower, double sink vanity, jetted tub, butler's pantry on each floor, TV, closet, sofa, etc... make the stay near perfection. Having a large room with a comfortable sofa to watch TV is unusual and is the balcony with french doors. The only on-site bar and restaurant were a bit over the top for business travel and the staff were unsure about recommendations to other options within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lacks security”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler9904
Reviews.Content: During a 3 night stay at Hotel ZaZa in March I returned to my room one afternoon to find my door open. I had been gone for about 12 hours and the room had been serviced, so I don't know for how long my door was open. I called the front desk to notify them and to also ask for an explanation from either the cleaning staff or hotel management as to why my door was open. I never recieved a response. I was concerned and wanted to know who was in the room and why my belongings and my personal safety were at risk. When I completed an online survey from the hotel about my stay I mentioned this incident and once again no one responded to me. How can I suggest this hotel to anyone? I wouldn't want my wife, co-worker, colleague, anybody to be placed in a compromised situation. My guess is that the door was left ajar unintentionally. But I deserve a response. What if an intruder had broken into my room? What if trouble was lurking on the other side of the door? There isn't any lobby security that asks to see a key before getting on the elevators. Anyone can freely roam the halls at Hotel ZaZa. Now, the service in the bar was great. The valet guys were great. The front desk with the exception of the person I lodged my compaint with, was great. I travel about twice a month during the course of a year for both business and pleasure. I visit Texas about 5 times a year. There is no way I would stay at ZaZa again. I have never returned to a hotel room to find my door open for any and all to have access to. They should have looked at the security tapes and let me know exactly who was in and out of the room. All I wanted was an explanation. I didn't want nor did I ask for a room comp, food comp, etc. We all need safety to be a hotels number one concern.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little too pretentious”
Reviews.Author: jerseyshoredeb
Reviews.Content: Upscale boutique hotel filled with Dallas socialites on a shopping spree or girls night. I stay here for business. The rooms are opulent. The beds very comfortable. The lighting in the rooms is very low for the ambiance, difficult to do work by. Bathrooms are large and robes are provided. The restaurant downstairs strongly enforces a dress code, so if you're a business traveler getting in after a long flight, you may want to order room service (which may break your expense account) or go to one of the local restaurants in walking distance. I've seen women in dressy thong sandals not be allowed to enter because of the shoes. Wednesday does have half price food but given the prices it's still not a terrible great deal. There is an outdoor patio area. I have not been in the pool. Typical of a boutique hotel, in the morning in the lobby area of each floor is complimentary coffee and teas.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay anywhere but ZaZa.”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian6161
Reviews.Content: What can I say...absolutely the best hotel experience I have ever had in Dallas and definitely ranks in my top 5 across the country and I travel a lot. The service was friendly and spot on at every turn. ZaZa has a very warm attitude that is extremely comforting. The rooms are large and feel like home. What a great bed! Don't miss dragonfly, the restaurant and bar at the hotel. Great food, great service, great atmosphere...what more could you ask for! Don't miss ZaZa the next time you are in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Second time and will go back”
Reviews.Author: sharpei123
Reviews.Content: Very trendy, ostentacious, expensive, and small. My lady and I stayed at one of the Magnificent Seven Rooms (The Dangerous Beauty) for the second time (the first about a year ago) and, again, loved it. The room was very quiet, large, and plush. Some might think the hotel was a little much, with a few nude paintings and sculptures and some very trendy furniture, but we loved it. The french toast we had for breakfast and the beef tenderloin we had for dinner were second to none and some of the best I ever had. My only complaint was the price (the room was $650 a night), but you get what you pay for and we got a lot. Probably can' t afford to go often, but we will make this stay a yearly event. The staff was very friendly and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Cheesy and arrogant, the Zaza is the insecure kid who's trying too hard to be popular.”
Reviews.Author: venicebeachbum
Reviews.Content: If you can sleep through anything, than your experience won't be as bad as mine was. Walls are thin, floors are thinner, so I had guests stomping on my head all night, every night. To make things even more interesting, a DJ spins at the pool every Friday and Saturday from 10P to 2A, so if you're on that side of the hotel, say goodbye to a restful night's sleep. The staff is arrogant--for no good reason, at that--almost all the staff was inefficient and rude. The hotel facade, along with the facade its employees put on, just show how absolutely hard to be cool. It's quite pathetic. I'm from Los Angeles, and this hotel takes the cake in the cheese factor. That's saying a lot. The hotel is a magnet for partygoers, so on the weekends, it's a madhouse: loud, drunk people in the hallway. I thought I had already graduated college and moved out of my dorm, but this puts me right back in college. What I can say about the hotel is that it recognizes its weakness. Every room comes with an air filter that you can blast to try to drown out noise. (Try being the operative word.) The location is pretty good--it's within walking distance to many restaurants and bars. Besides the location, though, I have nothing positive to say about the Zaza. It's a hotel that feels like it got dressed up in a fresh coat of paint, glittering with cheap chandelier accessories, and called itself "high-class." But take a closer look, and you'll see that it, along with its clientele, are just playing dress-up. Class can't be bought, people.

Reviews.Title: “Caution”
Reviews.Author: mickeynyc
Reviews.Content: Still a great boutique hotel, but the clientele has gotten a little less desirable especially on weekends. I felt somewhat unsafe with the crowd that was hanging out in the hotel and the restaurant/ lounge (Firefly). And BE CAUTIOUS...we used the ATM in the lobby, and this was the only ATM we used on our trip, and someone was able to copy our ATM card and used it the next day at a local electronics store and emptied our account. Hotel Zaza and the Firefly does not have the great fun trendy atmosphere it used to have, the crowd has become somewhat questionable and the experience was uncomfortable. Be very aware when you are there during the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but their Dragonfly Restaurant is Another Story”
Reviews.Author: luke47
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is beautiful and the staff are very friendly. This is my second stay here and I stayed in a very nice "regular - superior" room. The theme suites and the Magnificant Seven look amazingly beautiful. We had dinner on Wednesday night in their Dragonfly Restaurant. Their website says "half off " the menu - an excellent deal for theur very overpriced food. When we were making our reservation, we specifically asked if this included their steaks. The answer was "yes." So, upon ordering, our server and the manager said "no, steaks are not half off." We explained our call and said that they were on the menu like any other item. Well, it was downhill after that. Our server ramped up her haughty attitude, acting like she was doing a favor waiting on us. I had to to return my Ginger Beef Tenderloin because it was ice cold. A friend ordered the Whole Branzini (fish) and it was horrible: mushy and tasteless. Thank heaven I only had to pay $18.50 for my tenderloin instead of the crazy $37 price tag. All in all, a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: catv41
Reviews.Content: Sexy would go back. Beautiful, great service and nightlife!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ZaZa NEVER Disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: travelcricket
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel ZaZa before. In fact, this is my third time. I am not sure of others saying that ZaZa does not WOW, because I am excited each time I arrive at ZaZa. The staff is incredible. The GM, Noel is probably one of, if not THE best GM I have ever come in contact with. It is like being at a very upscale Four Seasons Hotel, with a heavy dose of southern hospitality. In the lobby, they sit out sweet tea for the guest. The restaurant Dragonfly is beautiful, not to mention the out-of-this world food the serve. On the weekends, some of the best parties in Downtown/Uptown Dallas are right at Dragonfly. I have experienced their New Year's Eve Party (annual) and it is like no other! Their rooms are spacious and the Magnificent 7 suites are gorgeous if you want something more private and a space that is reminescent of a villa-style. ZaSpa is a must try also. This time I arrived for a wedding and to attend All Star Weekend. The weather was not good in Dallas. Actually there was a cold front and snow all over the country with the exception of CA, FL and Hawaii. No matter how chilly it was outside Hotel ZaZa was very hot. There were many professional athletes and entertainers in ZaZa during All Star Weekend. I guess that should come as no surprise to me, ZaZa is the ONLY hotel I would ever book my accommodations with! It is centrally located to everything (restaurants and nightlife included). If you ever are in Dallas, make sure you stay at Hotel ZaZa. I have never been disappointed, and neither will you!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ZaZa didn't Wow”
Reviews.Author: Furboyz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an event in Dallas and although we live in Grapevine and wanted to stay at Hotel ZaZa and were looking forward to our get away. Sadly, we were both very disappointed with our room. The robe was stained and looked like it had not been cleaned since the previous guests. It had what looked like grease spots. One of the chairs in our room was also broken. This was not at all up to par with the decorating style that ZaZa is known for but was clearly a broken chair. The toliet paper was also sand paper. The safe did not work, the decorative pillows were torn and ragged and one of the lights did not work. Our room felt like an average hotel room with used accesories. There was nothing special at all about it all. It was a let down. Actually coming back into the hotel after our event and seeing a couple of drunk people in the lobby from Dragonfly even cheapen the hotel more for me. These were not the "beautiful" people that Dragonfly is known for at all. We are not prudes at all. It looked look like any other club with the twenty-somethings not able to hold their booze about to puke in the lobby and pass out. We wanted to have an after dinner drink and passed on that when we saw girl sleeping on the benches in the lobby outside and a guy yelling at another. Sorry...but this is not Dallas' finest to us!! And not why we paid a premium price for our hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “The best day of my life...”
Reviews.Author: hez50
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zaza, Dallas was the venue for our recent wedding on Decemeber 19th, 2009. The staff at Hotel ZaZa made our wedding a most memorable time. Rose Moore was absolutely wonderful and attentive. She stayed the entire evening to assist in anything that may arise. We stayed in one of the magificant 7 suites called Dangerous Beauty and it was stunning.The ballroom was a fantastic place to hold our reception allowing approx. 90 guests to dance, eat and drink and share in our happiness. We can't thank Hotel ZaZa enough for making this day the best of our lifes.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: rockjeans21
Reviews.Content: An arrogant night staff that gives horrible customer service. I stayed on the 4th floor and you must swipe a card to gain access to the floor. All night we had issues with the card not working and not allowing us access to our room, and many other guest had the same problem. You must have the "magic touch" to swipe the card correctly. At the end of the night one of my guests ended up getting locked out of the room due to this issue, and long story short the staff would not let her up even though she had a key. They would not even let her call the room with the hotel phone. Once I finally found out she was waiting in the lobby (she was in tears) I went down to get her and then my key didn't work. The reservation wasn't under my name so the staff wouldn't give me access either! It was very clear we were staying in this room but the staff showed very poor customer service and poor judgement.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD SERVICE! DO NOT PLAN YOUR WEDDING OR EVENT AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Katie_Flynn08
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I were so extremely excited to have made the decision to have our wedding at Hotel Zaza and we have diligently spent the last 9 months planning on our big day! However, we were very disappointed with the issues and service that we received during our wedding. We completely understand that no wedding is prefect and issues do occur. However, we were even more let down by the attitude and they way that we were treated by the staff in attempting the resolve these items. I have listed some of them below. â€¢ We paid upfront for our guests to have complementary valet parking. However, 90% of our guest were charged anywhere from $5.50 to $9 per car upon their departure. My friends and relatives mentioned that they were with the wedding party and that they My family aunderstood this fee to be included. They were basically told that valet parking was not included and that if they wanted their car they would need to pay. â€¢ My husband and his groomsmen went down to the pool/cocktail area around 5pm dressed in their tuxedos to smoke before the wedding. They were rudely told that they the pool/cocktail area was designated for â€œhotel guestsâ€� only. This was inappropriate due to the fact that we spent a substantial amount of money and we were obviously staying at the hotel. â€¢ My family and friends observed the Zaza staff sitting down at tables during the reception eating. For the staff to sit at a table during a wedding reception visible to other guests is ridiculous! My thoughts are that the staff should eat only after an event and after all guests have eaten. â€¢ We ran out of the beef tenderloin early in the evening. The amount of guests was accurate to the amount that we paid for. So running out of food was not a miscalculation due to more guest than expected. â€¢ I noticed that several of our guests were drinking beverages in plastic cups. I was not trying to nit-pick, but we paid for our wedding to be at Hotel Zaza! My expectations were that no guests should be drinking out of cheap plastic cups. â€¢ We had more than 5 meetings with our Zaza event coordinators. (Our original coordinator was evidently let go.) And, it was understood that current coordinator, Rose More was to be at our reception as our liaison and ensure that everything went well. However, she did not attend. â€¢ After the wedding we attempted to bring our concerns to the attention of our coordinator, Rose More. Most specifically, the issue pertaining to the valet. Rose became defensive and basically denied that this issues could have happened. Our concerns where met with a very defensive tone. Our phone calls where slow to be returned. My husband and mother had to go up to the hotel to get any resolution to these issues. Despite the above concerns, our wedding was very beautiful and fantastic! However, in retrospect, we just would not have chosen this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: Dustinsouth
Reviews.Content: I loved the young hip feel of the hotel. Probably not the best location for a work related visit to Dallas. I will be recommending this hotel to people traveling to Dallas for a social visit

Reviews.Title: “hip, fun, and sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: hailhim88
Reviews.Content: swanky but affordable hotel near crescent court where most of my clients are at. popping scene at the pool at night and reasonably priced room service. book it.

Reviews.Title: “Pet-friendly, Great for young couples, Amazing beds”
Reviews.Author: gettinaround
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a Saturday night and the club downstairs was very busy and loud. The crowd in the halls were clearly having a good time too. If we had intended to party with a young, trendy crowd, this would have been the perfect weekend hotel. Since we were not, I feel the need to stress avoiding staying here on the weekend unless you want to be part of the action. On the upsides: we brought our dog and found that the hotel staff is very dog-friendly (even had bone treats and a dog bowel near the front door). The beds are super comfy and the restaurant was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Designed for business travel”
Reviews.Author: JB-Philly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is designed for the beautiful people who love to party all night long. Since I was travelling for business, this hotel did not suite my needs. The hotel is a hotspot for the Dallas "in crowd". It hosts parties throughout the week. On a Wednesday night , one would not expect to hear music pumping at midnight. The weekends are even crazier. During the week I was there , I had a drunk twentysomething fall on me while her boyfriend undressed in the elevator ; and while walking in the hallway had a couple graphically describe what they plan to do to each other once they got back to their room. If you are travelling as a couple and like a nightclub atmosphere, this would suite your needs. Every light is on a dimmer to set the mood. The hotel offers a turndown service which includes, candles, chocolate, and a filled ice bucket. Everything you need after that is located on the minibar ( vitamin E shots,condoms, vodka, mixers, oxygen canister??) I would highly recommend not staying here if you are travelling with children. This place is designed for adults. The room was comfortable. The bed was excellent. The lighting in the room was a little dark( not great for reading or other type of work). The internet connection worked well and was relatively fast. The hotel doesn't offer any type of ammenties worthy of comments. A newspaper in the morning at the front desk and ice tea at night is all you get. As a business traveler, I usually appreciate things like a small breakfast , and a quiet place to work at the end of the day. This is hard to find at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't go back”
Reviews.Author: DrFtheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: I travel monthly all over the world and love trying new hotels and have been looking forward to Hotel Zaza for quite some time. I had such high hopes and loved the idea of how hip and sexy it would be. I envisioned relaxing after business all day around the pool with a martini at this quiet boutique hotel. The rooms was definitely nice and met my expectation as well as the huge bowls of hot tamales in the common areas but that is where it ends. Hotel Zaza was the noisiest and unrestful hotel I have ever stayed at. The pool was tiny and could only accomodate about 12 people in it if they were all standing shoulder to shoulder. The pool looked like the cast of Beverly Hills 90210 had taken over. I am a 40 year old body builder and in pretty darn good shape and even I was somewhat intimidated my the crowd. I was afraid the bouncer at the pool gate would send me back to my room with an ugly citation. At 8 pm the pool turns into a nightclub for anyone in Dallas that wants to come. Suddenly your sexy boutique hotel turns into a big party scene with the majority being nonguests. We went back to our room to get some privacy and noticed a man standing on the roof outside our window. We were alarmed and were about to call security when we noticed it was the DJ for the party. Both Friday and Saturday we had the uninvited company of the hotel DJ standing outside our window. Walking back to our room after a very nice dinner off property we could hear large vomiting coming from some of the rooms as we passed them. Drunken guests ran up and down the hallways until three in the morning. I know I am probably sounding like a prude and really I am not. I love a fun party just like everyone else but I would rather it be at a night club and then be able to come back to my peaceful hotel afterwards. I could never recommend this hotel to a friend but it would probably be a good fit for a bunch of spring breakers. Please, Please, Please, do not take your children to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Got me out of hot water, BIG THANKS”
Reviews.Author: KevinLock
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, and the staff was a HUGE help in getting me out of Hot Water, (I forgot my wife birthday was coming up). Don set me up with a great package the included breakfast, and spa. The spa was wonderful, Camile, was just great at the front desk. So anyone needing a fast getaway, this is the place to do it. Thank you all Donn, Spa, and Camile you save my butt ï�Š)

Reviews.Title: “Chic and modern hotel but not for everybody”
Reviews.Author: micha74b
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get a way for the weekend, no kids no nothing and really wanted to spoil ourselves and wanted to feel like a million bucks. The service is great in the hotel. They make you feel like you are all that! We decided on a concept suite, the Bohemian. Looks great on their webpage but in real life it was more like Draculaâ€™s dungeon. See the pictures. Bed was wonderful, but the decor was just not our thing. We decided to downgrade to a regular suite with balcony (very beautiful). Be aware of the hidden costs.... $20 per night for valet parking, the fridge is full with drinks (can of coke $4!), also the bath room offers shaving cream ($28) and other little cool spa/ personal hygiene items.... but all at extra charge. We did not eat at the restaurant. There is a required dress code. Overall, this is a modern hotel with its own style maybe for younger couples. I would not recommend this hotel for a stay with children or a family vacation. The guests are usually younger, trendy and wealthy. I also would not recommend this hotel if you are looking more for a traditional and more quiet/ relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: ddelux
Reviews.Content: We came to ZaZa for an overnight stay. It was our anniversary. Our room was beautiful and the staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful. We will return. The hotel is very convenient to many of the sights and shopping areas of Dallas without being in the middle of downtown. You can safely walk the neighborhood around this hotel any time of the day.

Reviews.Title: “ZaZa Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Liz_Stelz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at ZaZa during a business trip from 8/13 through 8/16 and chose it because we wanted something other than a regular "convention type" hotel. We only paid $200 per night which we felt was a good bargain for the quality of the hotel. First of all EVERYBODY is extremely professional but also very friendly from the doormen, the bell staff, the front desk, the restaurant staff, the spa staff and the housekeeping staff. You couldn't pass anyone without getting a nice greeting and a "if I can do anything for you please ask." There was not a disgruntled employee in the bunch. We got two couples massages and the massage therapists were absolutely fantastic (Edith and Alec) and were probably the best massages we've ever had. They were $100+ per person for a 50 minute massage but were well worth it. The hotel itself is beautiful and the room is very relaxing - good sheets, pillows, bath robes, workable desk with enough pencils, paper, etc. The restaurant food is excellent and we tried it for breakfast each day and dinner one night. The pool area is small but we were able to lay out by the pool one afternoon that it wasn't too crowded and got a nice lounger. The bartender came around and catered to our drink needs and also came around with a bucket full of popcicles for everybody (gratis) - nice touch. Of course, the price of the drinks are quite high but we kind of expected that. You do have to watch the cost of some of the items as nothing at ZaZa is inexpensive but we expected to pay more than usual and we were treating ourselves so it was fine. The bellmen were very helpful in choosing restaurants, making reservations and even printed out exact directions for us. The only real downside was that on Friday and Saturday night the pool/bar area outside is a real party location with so many people from outside the hotel that we found it impossible to get in. Also, be prepared for the rich, blond, 20 something year old crowd because that is what frequents ZaZa in the evening and around the pool, We are in our late 40's and are used to a younger group but some people may not be comfortable in that atmosphere. Finally, it seems that the hotel gives it's employees the power to make every guests' stay memorable. We met the Director of Housekeeping in the elevator on the last full day of our stay and she inquired how were doing and if we enjoyed wine and what kind. We told her we drink Pinot Noir and that night when we got back to our room there was a complimentary bottle of Pinor Noir from her with a nice card. It was a very nice way to end our stay. Thank you Maria LaFuentes!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: rabthekebab
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here couldn't fault it. Thought it was one of the best places I've stayed. In saying that, I never used the pool or the dinning area, just stayed in it. Was there for 1st wedding anniversary. Good to get to JFK site and being a Dallas (TV show) fan it was handy to jump the train to Southfork. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Our bottle of celebratory champagne was confiscated upon our arrival!”
Reviews.Author: Dovemodel
Reviews.Content: A small group of forty-something women plan a weekend trip to Dallas.We pick the Hotel ZaZa as it looks to be upscale with excellent service. Upon arrival, our bottle of champagne and a six pack of beer are confiscated by the hotel staff . We are told that we can not bring in alcohol or our own food(crackers, cheese etc.)Obviously ,we are irritated and quite frankly ,offended, being treated as though we are on spring break. We head to the pool and are told we were not lucky enough to get one of the six chaise lounge chairs that are not reserved.We will have to reserve and pay the two hundred and fifty dollar bottle fee to lay by the pool. We can ,however, sit on our towels on the cement if we like. Our last night,coincidentally ,the electricity went off in our room(and our room only,I kid you not) for twenty-five minutes. We found the management to be condescending when inquiring about the policies of the hotel and reasons for not listing them on the website. The only redeeming quality of this hotel is the service in the dining room LOOK ELSE-WHERE!!

Reviews.Title: “It was cool...but overall, not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: sincityjenn
Reviews.Content: Well, let me start off by saying that Hotel Zaza is absolutely beautiful! The tapestries, the chandeliers, etc.. They have themed rooms which looked pretty cool. If you want a balcony room, make sure you just book it and not hope for that free upgrade. Balcony rooms are the first to go! You feel very welcomed from when you get out of your car to when you leave. The doorman was super nice and very personable. You can even bring a pet, although I don't know what the restrictions or charges are for that. Oh yeah, this is not a place to bring your kids unless they are 21+. It's a very poshy adult scene at Hotel Zaza. You will probably be a bit uncomfortable with your kids. The Rooms. The rooms are way cute with a very modern feel. We stayed in the deluxe 425 sq. ft. room. Our friend stayed in the smaller 384 sq. ft. room and it was also cute. Same decor, smaller room, so there's not too much space. It's worth the extra dollars to get the larger room. It's more open and roomier. We got the room on the "Club ZaZa Level" which is the 4th floor. You can only access this floor by swiping your card key in the elevator. But from what I heard, there really is no difference in rooms between a normal room and a Club Zaza level room. It's just a more secured floor. The bathroom was large and they let you use a complimentary robe. There are little toiletry baskets in the bathroom. Some is free (shampoo, conditioner, lotion) but the rest is not. So be careful when taking that stuff and be clear on which items you have to pay for and which items you don't. There is a price list in this basket. There is also a mini fridge and a snack basket in the room. The price list ranges from a $4 kit-kat (small size) to a $5 soda. There are liquor bottles in there as well from GreyGoose to Johnny Walker Black Label, to wines, and even champagne. Again, check the prices on these items before you grab. If you hate the noise and prefer quiet either stay at another hotel or ask to be placed at the opposite end of the pool/Dragonfly Lounge area. It is quite noisy. Our room was the furthest away (but facing the pool's direction, we had a clear view of the pool area) and we heard the music crystal clear. It didn't bother us, but if you're the type it would bother, I wouldn't recommend staying here. The Food. The food is great! I had brunch there and it was excellent! But be warned....four of us ate and only ordered 2 liquor drinks and our bill was $100...without the tip! I ordered a cheeseburger and 2 drinks for my husband one night (room service) and it was $30...without a tip. If you order room service, just order the food if you want a soda. It's $4 for a soda in the fridge, but $5-6 for the same soda on room service. The next morning we ate breakfast and it was just under $100 because we kept it at coffee and juice this time. Valet. Be warned that if you park your vehicle there it is $7 a day or $20 overnight fee. So if you're staying for three nights, you are paying $60 upon check-out. This is whether or not you are a guest! Dragonfly Lounge/Night Life. The night life is popping on Fridays and Saturday nights! They have a DJ and it's really cool and fun. If you are a guest, enter the club through the roped off area in the main lobby area. Show them your card and you're in. Otherwise, you will be waiting in a LONG line outside to get in where non-guests are, and trust me, there is a lot of people who want to get in this place! The Dragonfly Lounge area is outside and VERY small. They pack people in pretty tight, so be careful not to fall into the pool! There is one bar, but the bar is only 5 ft. long, so if you want a drink (as a guest) get your drinks inside. There are doormen outside each door to go inside and will stop everyone who does not have a room key. So it's not as crowded inside or noisy. Plus you can relax and socialize at the bar or at the tables. I noticed on Friday and Saturday night there were security guards on the 4th floor when I was going back to my room. I'm not sure if this is on every floor on those nights, but it makes you feel a little safer that random people aren't going to be walking through the hallways, hopefully. Hint: If you aren't 21 then don't stay here. We saw so many people guests and non-guests getting denied at the door because they weren't of age. And they were not shy about denying people. A lot of people were denied access. One girl made a scene because she was a guest and she couldn't get in. All and all this is a pretty swanky hotel. Although we could have received an awesome and larger suite at another 5 star hotel for the same price. Is it worth the extra money? Not really, in my opinion. Like I said, you can get a lot more and better for the same price at another 5 Star hotel/resort. We feel a little like we wasted money for nothing. And trust me, we have stayed at some top of the line hotels/resorts and we do not mind spending more money for nicer amenities, etc.. But we were not that impressed with this hotel. I've received bigger, better, and nicer things for what we paid there.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Music! Unapologetic staff!”
Reviews.Author: SECSECSEC
Reviews.Content: This hotel decided to have a party right outside our room with extremely loud music! It's unacceptable and absurd to think that a hotel facilitates a LOUD party till at least 1 AM on it's own property. This is not a hotel- it's more like a night club. Two thumbs way, way down!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, really recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Mark_J_G
Reviews.Content: Loved the whole experience from start to finish. Decor is superb, the rooms are fantastic with great furnishings, very thoughtfully decorated. Staff are all very friendly, can't help enough. Cool bar, great little pool. Will always definitley stay there in Dallas

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BRING CHILDREN”
Reviews.Author: Cubanchic
Reviews.Content: We planned a family weekend vacation - arrived on a Friday, went to our rooms and was somewhat disturbed by the art work in the halls - the art is very "edgy" and with sexual implications. We then went down to the pool that was FULL of 20+ year olds looking to "hook up"; a couple in the pool was making out and some girl kept yelling out the F word to some other person. To make matters worse, even when alerted the management did not seem to care at all. In the elevator on our trip back up to our rooms a drunk girl was talking out loud to another how she would go with any guy up to the fourth floor of the hotel (the fourth floor needs a pass key). We left, sacrificing a travelocity paid trip (no refunds), and stayed at another hotel - this was not an appropriate place for young children. If you are young looking for fun, this is the place. All others should stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull rooms”
Reviews.Author: RuchiD
Reviews.Content: the restaurant, pool side bar and the room decor is really nice and welcoming after a long day of work in dry heat of dallas...very nice choice of hotel to stay in downtown dallas

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service & Stay”
Reviews.Author: HotMess04
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came in from Chicago to visit friends. We were happily greeted by 3 front desk guys who were eager to make us feel like VIP's. They had us laughing when we checked in after a long day, yet were so professional at the same time. They seemed to actually care how our trip into Dallas was, and were clearly the individuals that ran the entire hotel!! They remembered our names everytime we entered the lobby that night and showed us "Southern hospitality." I will NEVER stay at The W again, or that boring hotel across the street. The housekeepers always acknowledged us as we roamed the halls, and were quick in responding to our every request. (We were very high demand, which probably was a result of the way we were treated upon entrance.) I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to have fun and experience the trendiness of Dallas. I thought Texas was all land and cattle! Definitely don't stay if you are into a stuffy, quiet atmosphere. (The Ritz is down the street if you want that.) THANK YOU ZAZA!! PS--The only downfall was the restaurant. They could use work.

Reviews.Title: “Sensuous Luxury on Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: NomadicNina
Reviews.Content: Have stayed st this property several times over last couple of years--great break from routine of ordinary luxury business hotels. This place is FUN! Dimly lit, luxurious inviting appointments, sensuous photographs at every turn, doting staff, fab restaurant and lobby for meetings/ drinks/ food. Love the pulse, refreshing to step into the zaza and off the track of corporate schedulings. Rejuvenating and beautiful environment that awakens the senses while luring you to a great night's sleep. Try it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Teacher78732
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I are not "trendy" people. We were just looking for a clean, nice hotel, at a good proximity to the places we needed to go downtown. What a nice surprise to find a luxury hotel with a staff so willing to go the extra mile for whatever we needed. From the valets to the desk and housekeeping staff, everybody was so friendly and cheerful. The rooms were fabulous, with beds that were hard to get out of! Rooms were upscale, yet not ostentatious. Not a bit of the snobbery, one might expect in a "trendy" hotel, was encountered on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: marktxTexas
Reviews.Content: The customer service at Hotel ZaZa is terrible !!! The employees are rude and very unprofessional. Most of the employees working at the hotel were just kids. When we complained about the horrible customer service, we found the both of the "so called Managers" at the hotel were just kids also. It was shocking to hear to the immature, unprofessional statements made by the kids that are supposedly operating this hotel . To make the bad experience even worse, their restaurant bar tender attempted to steal our credit card information. When we reported the fraudulent activity to the Hotel Manager, the Manager just made excuses and attempted to cover up the crime. Beware of this hotel. If you want a quality, professionally operated hotel in that area, the Ritz Carlton or the Westin is a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “loved hotel zaza”
Reviews.Author: jkandethan27
Reviews.Content: we found the best rate at hotels.com we booked a couple days before we left and only payed 118.00 per night which was for a deluxe parlor, which was very nice. we never stayed at a place like that. the room had some high end shaving cream and aftershave lotion, dont use it unless u want to pay 30 dollars a bottle. the fridge was fully stocked with stuff to make mix drinks ,which we did not touch because it was way high and the goody basket on top of the fridge ,a bag of chips or candy bar 4.00 , we left it alone. our room had a retro yet classic feel. plasma flat screen with marble bathroom floors and counters, nice shower, candles lit in room when we came in and average comfy bed. the place was decorated beautifully and the concierge was very helpful. The dragonfly restraunt was very expensive but tasty and i even seen two famous people , if my eyes did not deceive me. i am pretty for sure it was them. i am a small town girl so the urge to ask for a pic ate at me, and they did not tell us when we check in and never having stayed at a place that nice, we did not know, but they charge us 20 a day for valet parking. we would go back only if we received a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Stay”
Reviews.Author: HoustonCountryMan
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully designed hotel. Love the suites, the decor and the design of the rooms.Room service food is good although high and the servers are friendly. The servers are the friendliest people. Housekeeping is ok and the front desk is snooty. Stayed here for 4 days. Enjoyed the nice rooms but the front desk were not friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for people watching but not as great as I had hoped.”
Reviews.Author: c_stogs
Reviews.Content: First I have to say the hotel is very neat or trendy and great for people watching as you never know who you'll see coming in and out of the hotel. Our room was ok probably would have been better if it was one of their theme suits but was nothing spectacular and a little on the small side. Service at check-in was prompt and courteous. The bellmen and valet guys were very nice and full of information regarding the local area. The bar/resturant was ok our dinner was pretty good but nothing outstanding. The pool area is nice but pretty small and on a sunny day could be very packed. The only major complaint was the door on our mini-bar was falling off so you had to watch how you opened or closed it or it would end up on your toes. But as the title states the hotel was nice but not as great as I had heard from so many people.

Reviews.Title: “A great, unique hotel in a good spot in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: SFGuy35
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zaza is a near-luxury hotel with a surprisingly unique personality. I stayed there on business for a night close to Halloween, and the holiday couldn't have been more appropriate. The hotel is already festooned with neo-gothic, Victorian flourishes--it's thoroughly modern, but the retro patterned deep-red fabrics and elaborate ironwork on display are charming, and fit right in with the spooky Halloween decor. The room was utterly massive, almost too big -- a trip from the desk to the bathroom was like walking across an airplane hangar. Internet, unfortunately, was slow like molasses, whether via wifi or the convenient ethernet cord. Comfy bed, no noise from nearby rooms. The hotel is slightly large to be a boutique property -- going from the elevator to the room was a bit of a hike. Workout room pretty well-equipped, but unfortunately the pool was closed for the season despite the 80-degree temperatures. The location on the main strip in "uptown" Dallas is very convenience. Golds Gym right across the street and many restaurants & nightclubs within walking distance. Some street parking but be careful: I got a ticket at 8:30pm in a space that said it was only restricted til 6pm. Who knows why. All-in-all a lovely spot.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times at ZaZa”
Reviews.Author: mediagirldallas
Reviews.Content: Some girlfriends and I originally wanted to plan an exciting trip to a fun location BUT due to busy schedules ended up deciding to stay local. We wanted to pick a nice hotel with a fun atmosphere and narrowed the choices down to the W and ZaZa. Read mixed reviews of both on this site so started to question if either would be worth the expense. We chose ZaZa since it was different and unlike your typical hotel. We LOVED it! The room was great (not much of a view), nicely decorated and beds were comfy. We unpacked and quickly headed down for a beverage by the pool. Have to admit is was quite the scene. After a few drinks went back to the room to get ready for dinner at Dragonfly. The service was fantastic and the food was tasty...my only complaint was that the waitress kept call me ma'am...ugh....she's wasn't that much younger than me! After our fun, tasty dinner headed out to the pool bar area. This is definitely the place to be and be seen. As the night went on...more and more people packed into the area. Good music, fun people and great people watching. The next day headed to the spa for some much needed detoxing (highly recommended :). We went by the pool area to relax and get some sun; however, due to the hotel not monitoring if people are guests of the hotel (you can pretty much walk in off the street) didn't stay bc we couldn't find a place to park ourselves. Overall...well worth it and look forward to going back but will take the hubby next time. Only complaints are the open pool access during the day and the not so pleasant smell in the elevator (smelled like someone wasn't able to hold their liquor...ewww).

Reviews.Title: “Zaza rocks”
Reviews.Author: colou
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Avant- garde Boutique hotel with a staff with a great attitude! The pictures on the website don't do the decorating justice and it really is a well run hotel. Rooms are large, furniture, rugs and bathrooms are clean and new. Bathroom products are Molton Brown and plentiful... Beds are super comfy and sheets are luxury soft and spotless. The rooms closer to the pool are a bit noisy at night due to the DJ and the lounge happenings, so if you want quiet, go for the other side of the hotel. We had room 320 which was right over the front entrance and we had a fabulous balcony and we didn't hear a peep. The pool is great, with misters, fans and a hot tub. The bartender brings cold towels and ice pops around during the hot afternoons. Definitely a place for friends or couples, would not recommend to families and certainly not for children. I wouldn't even recommend it to the serious business person. Only the semi-serious!! We really enjoyed our stay and we are now ZaZa fans - we will follow this hotel if it opens it's doors anywhere else....

Reviews.Title: “Incredible--Magnificent Seven!”
Reviews.Author: soccergrldfw
Reviews.Content: Hotel ZaZa was awesome! It was our one year anniversary and I didn't have time to take a real vacation, so I thought a stay at a local spot would hopefully be just as romantic. I had booked one of the one bedroom Magnificent Seven rooms, but when I called to see if I could get in at an early check in time, the guy in that suite apparently was refusing to leave. So they offered a complimentary upgrade (mind you, this was still well before the normal check in time) to a two bedroom Mag Seven suite--the Crouching Tiger Suite. It was incredible!! The decor was awesome, I mean, a little over done for a room in a house, but really amazing for a hotel. Full kitchen with appliances. My only complaint was that the coffee pot wasn't clean, there was still a left over substance in the martini mixer, and a martini glass wasn't clean. But I can get over that because I wasn't planning on making a martini or coffee. But there was a dishwasher in there if I wanted to clean it myself. There was also a washer and dryer, which was great for swimsuits after the pool. They even brought us complimentary champagne and chocolate covered strawberries because of the "inconvenience". All this after upgrading us! We got in-room massages which were incredible as well. Everyone was very friendly and attentive. Service was always quick and on-time. They really did go above and beyond to make our one year anniversary special. It's something that we will never forget. I highly recommend Hotel ZaZa--especially a Magnificent Seven suite!

Reviews.Title: “What?”
Reviews.Author: gzcvrn
Reviews.Content: I decided to show off Dallas a bit to family and friends who were visiting from OH and decided that a stop at Hotel ZaZa (Dragonfly/Urban Oasis) would be the best Dallas "hot spot" to wow them with after a fantastic dinner at Cyclone Anayas. Needless to say, my guests were very impressed as we walked into the hotel lobby. Two headed into Dragonfly to order drinks while another and I made a stop at the restroom. My friend and I were stopped as we attempted to enter Dragonfly because he was wearing flipflops. We were informed that there was a no flipflop policy. What?. I can respect a dress code (on a side note...it is Dallas, Summer, still 90 degrees at 10pm) but he was wearing nice linen shorts and an Izod. I also felt that the delivery was a bit snobby and pretentious. I entered the restaurant to try to cancel the drinks but I was too late so we took the drinks to the hallway leading up to the restaurant. After sitting for a few minutes, we were informed that we could not stay or sit in the hallway area becuase 1 guest was wearing flipflops and that we would have to take our drinks to the hotel lobby. What? We remained respectful but voiced our complaint. As we were sitting in the lobby, we watched several young ladies enter the restaurant and bar, wearing flipflops. We inquired and were told very curtly that the no flipflop policy only applied to men, as directed by the hotel owner. What? We finished our drinks and left and I probably would not have had a problem except that the policy was not consistent and I still don't see how sitting in the lobby 30 feet from where we first sat really made a difference. Although I have been to the Hotel previously, I don't think that it will remain high on my list until some improvements are made. "Boutique" Hotel service is one thing, inconsistent policies and pretentious attitude are another.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at ZAZA!”
Reviews.Author: DuckSausage
Reviews.Content: The wife and I spent our 2nd wedding anniversary at Hotel ZaZa. It was great. Almost everything meet or exceeded our expectations. The decor/art was beautiful. The room was perfectly clean and the turn down service (with candles and chocolate) was very nice! So many hotels have flatscreen HD capable tv sets, but without a true HD signal...however, ZaZa has HD which we enjoyed! The furniture, bathroom, view, etc. was perfect. My only complaint, like the last review stated, is that you must watch your bill. We too were overbilled! All in all, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at the ZaZa...but watch your bill!”
Reviews.Author: jacktripper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel ZaZa on July 25th for one night. I must say that I was very impressed with the decor throughout the hotel. Our room itself was average size, but certainly packed a punch as far as details go. From the lamps to the etched glass window in the shower, it was quite unique. One warning though. Don't be too quick to use any of the products in the bathroom! They are not free. Upon checking my bill, I realized that we were charged 3 times for overnight parking. I had to call and have that removed. Today, I found another mysterious $9 charge on my AMEX. Now, I must make yet another call. That is annoying. We had dinner at the Dragonfly and it was fantastic. The service was wonderful and the food equally impressive. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: bathos13
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice weekend getaway and ZaZa proved the perfect fit! The room was amazing with a large sitting area, nice decor, plenty of space and an incredibly comfortable bed. The staff was excellent, from the valets to the front desk to the pool side wait staff. The spa is very nice and the massages were amazing - we had a married couple do our couples massage and they were perfect! Dragonfly has excellent food and a good atmosphere - and their room service is just as good, it took only 20 minutes to get our food and it was hot and fresh. The pool scene (both night and day) is trendy and a bit crowded - definitely the "look at me" crowd - but everyone was nice and the service was excellent. I'd also recommend walking across the street to the Crescent building and having dinner at Nobu. Amazing seafood and sushi with a contemporary atmosphere and excellent service. We will be staying there the next time we're in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room; funny smell, but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mrsslovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel ZaZa on July 13, 2008, for the George Michael concert. The hotel was beautiful, valet guys were fast, and check-in was a snap. We stayed in a deluxe parlor suite with two double beds and enjoyed our stay. We got to our room and it was gorgeous. This room looked like someone's small apartment. Loved the decor and the nice beds. Unfortunately, there was an unpleasant odor that you just could not over look. The odor smelled like someone just got through smoking pot in our room. The smell was so strong I asked the maids, who were down the hall claening rooms, to come in and spray our room with some deodorizer to help with the smell. It worked, but at the end of the night there was a little hint of it still left. Oh well, the room was still nice. I have to say I loved the turn down service that was provided. The maids came in, lite two candles and left salted cashews on my pillow. I'll take cashews over mints any day of the week! The next morning I did not want to get out of bed because the bed was so comfortable. They also have a little butler's station on each floor of the hotel, there are only four floors at this hotel, where there is complimentary coffee. My friend said the coffee was great. The location was also fantastic, the AA Center was just down the road and made it easy to get to the concert. I would stay here again! Happy traveling :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: R1lissa
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at Hotel Zsa Zsa on 06/06. Valet guys were very personable and attentive. We were greeted with champagne upon entering the lobby. Check-in was a breeze. We were on the third floor in a deluxe king parlor room. It was very nicely furnished but needed to be dusted. The bathroom was very nice with little extras such as individually packaged q-tips and cotton balls, a makeup mirror and a full size Conair hair dryer. Loved the tile shower with the bench. I never saw any snacks in the butler pantry on our floor- only coffee and hot tea. We didn't eat at Dragonfly, instead we walked to Sambuca (fabulous!). We did go to the Oasis Lounge (the pool/bar area) after dark. It's a very small pool area, so it was a little difficult to get around because it was packed. Lots of pretty women looking for rich men and rich men looking for pretty women. Drinks were very skimpy on the liquor. Our room faced the pool, so we could hear the DJ music until about 1:30 in the morning, but it wasn't obnoxiously loud. Overall, it was a very nice stay and I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirl1434
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so beautiful!...Very funky and fun. Check in was easy and fast. My boyfriend and I stayed in the ZaZa suite for 2 nights. The room was incredible. The decor was very romantic and comfortable. The bathroom was large and spacious and the bathtub was great for a candlelit bubblebath. Dinner at the Dragonfly was excellent. The waiters were very attentive and helpful. Drinks were excellent. I especially recommend their signature drink "The Kiss". Our stay was perfect and we plan to make it an annual trip!...Would highly recommend it for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Boutique experience you are looking for...”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob311
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at Hotel Zaza for 1 night while visiting friends in Dallas. I have to preface this review by mentioning that we are kind of hotel snobs. We are big fans of any Four Seasons or Aman resort but also like to stay at hip, fun places when possible (The Parker Palm Springs is a favorite). It is in that vein that we chose Zaza over more "upscale hotels" thinking we would get the best of both worlds- atmosphere and quality. I guess the atmosphere is fine- the decor is all you would expect it to be and the bar/ night club was PACKED on Saturday night. That all being said, I would categorize the hotel's style as more wanna be trendy than chic and what you get in decor you loose in service and cleanliness. The staff were all very nice but just not well trained or efficient. For instance, when we checked in, there were 2 bellmen waiting in the lobby not helping anyone yet neither followed us up to our room with our luggage. We had to wait 15 minutes and then call down to the front desk to get our bags delivered. Also, just after checking in, an employee came into our room without knocking to check that the room was ready for the next guests (us!!). She apparently had not been informed we already had checked in. Turn down service also missed our room for some reason. When I called down to housekeeping after returning to my room at 11pm, they quickly came and made up the room, however, it was frustrating to have to call. All of this could be forgiven however were it not for the lack of cleanliness in the room. The pillow cases were stained, the curtains were stained and WORST of all, i went to wash my face with a new towel housekeeping had just brought me and there was a big brown stain on it. I am willing to sacrifice elements of service for a fun boutique experience but dirty rooms and towels are unacceptable in my book. I would not stay here again. PROS: Lively bar scene. theme rooms. CONS: Poor service. Dirty rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlDva
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for two nights, and I have to say that it's one of my new favorite hotels! I loved it from the minute I walked into the fabulous lobby. The decor is beautiful and feels decadent, but with a funky vibe. My room was great - incredibly comfy bed, Italian linens, black-out curtains, wonderful chocolate velvet sofa, flat screen tv, nice marble bathroom, and a great glass shower with a seat. The workout facility was really nice, with lots of up-to-date equipment. I also had a service done at the ZaSpa, and I loved the soothing decor, but wasn't overly thrilled with my service (for what I paid). I talked to the spa manager, and she graciously offered to reduce the price that I paid, and was more than accomodating. I was very pleased with the way the situation was handled, and I would certainly go back and try the spa again. Overall, I think Hotel ZaZa is an incredible property. The service was top-notch, location is great, and my room was wonderful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, and certainly recommend it to anyone thinking about staying here. If you are looking for a unique hotel experience, give this hotel a try - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great furnishings, good size, very comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 2 night stay at the Hotel ZaZa in Dallas. I was coming back from Cancun (stayed at the Fiesta American Grand Coral Beach which was great). I was staying 2 nights before flying back home to Buenos Aires. I know Dallas very well as I formally lived in Dallas before moving to South America. Before flying to Cancun, I stayed at the Nylo in Plano which was nice. I posted a review of that stay as well. First of all, the location is really great and it's very close to downtown. Nothing really to do downtown but this area is in a very central location and close to both 75 Highway and also the Tollway so it's easy to get around. The lobby is very nice. I tried booking directly on their website but the reservation section wasn't working so I booked off of Expedia.com. I booked a suite and the rate with tax was about $250 per night. We checked in late afternoon and they had everything ready. It literally took just 3 minutes to swipe my credit card and they gave my keys to the room. I got in and both my fiance and I were really impressed with the rooms. I'm in the real estate and hospitality business so I do a LOT of furnishing of rental properties. I could see they spent some money on the finish out and furniture. The room itself was very spacious with high ceilings. It had a VERY comfortable king size bed and it had a HD LCD 42' inch TV which was very nice. it had a work desk with both wi-fi and cord complimentary Internet but service was very spotty for the 2 nights/3 days that we were there. It worked but the connection kept cutting off. I was impressed as the desk chair was VERY nice and comfortable. The bathroom was nice as well with marble countertops. Good size. The first night we were on the 2nd floor and the room was VERY noisy with the wind. It was very windy and we couldn't sleep as there was a loud whislting of the wind against the window. We thought maybe it was just this room. In the morning we asked to move to another room because of the noise. They were sold out but they said that at noon they would have another room. I told them we would pack our bags and they could move them. We went out and about doing lots of shopping and met up with a friend and they did indeed change our room and moved our bags. They moved us to the 3rd floor. That night there was still some noise with the wind and the windows but not as bad. I'm not sure if it was just this side of the building but there was lots of wind noise whistling into the room. Really that was the only complaint I had about the room. Keep in mind they do NOT have a parking lot to park your rental car. Dallas is one of those cities with very few taxis so you probably will rent a car. Note that they don't have a lot and only valet. The valet guys were very good. Of course you should tip them each time they bring your car. The hotel also charges you $18 per night for the valet car parking so note this. At the check-out everything was ok but we noted that they had an incorrect $78 for breakfast in the restaurant. We never went to the restaurant and in fact, had room service that same day. We pointed it out and they quickly took it off our bill. I'd suggest you review your bill in detail. Really, I was impressed with the hotel. Great staff and everyone was friendly. The location was very good and central and the size of the room was very nice. Nice LCD TV, nice desk with very upscale and comfortable chair, nice bathrooms and nice furniture. I'd highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: congoroom
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was a delightful surprise. I was going to be staying at the W, but heard from a friend that there was another hotel that started with a Z that was supposed to be good. The lady at the reception desk was a bit cold, but I have never been to a hotel where they were super. The entire experience up to my room was delightful. They had sweets (petite cakes) in the lobby by the elevators. When I got off on my floor, there was another coffee area. Everything is mood lit, including the dark elevators. I loved it! The room was great if you like dark, modern, fun. The concierge was delightful. Full of energy and very nice. The Valet boys were probably the best I have ever had! The Dragonfly bar staff were boring. This was probably my biggest disappointment. This is not your normal W or Hyatt. This is a FUN hotel with style.

Reviews.Title: “a barking dog ruined the experience”
Reviews.Author: oklahomasooner00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not as nice as I thought it would be. We started out in a room next door to a barking dog. After a few hours, a few phone calls and a trip to the front desk we finally got a different room down the hall, could still hear the dog but at least it wasn't next door. Pros: nice size rooms, good desserts in lobby, good location to restaurants and shopping. Cons: They allow pets, always a crowd at the restaurant on weekends-make sure if you want to eat there to book in advance. Valet is slow. Overall we had a good experience once the dog issue was resolved. I was a little dissapointed that the bed wasn't more comfortable. Also we stayed on a weekend and it seemed that there was quite a bit of noise outside (at 3:00 am). Still kind of surprised that pets are allowed, since this is an upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place year after year!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTandE
Reviews.Content: We go to the ZaZa every year for Valentine's Day weekend. Consistently, this is one of our favorite hotels in the world. The hotel has such a great feel about it - very welcoming, beautifully decorated, totally different, and an exciting aura all around the property. The staff is very friendly (especially Scott, Ryan, and Keith)- the food in the Dragonfly bar is reasonably priced and fabulous! We booked the Notorious Suite - see pix - and thought it is roomy, comfy, cozy, quiet, and very gorgeous. We wished for a newspaper, and on time room service, but other than that, our stay was flawlessly perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “terrific stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: robcanmelt
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 4 year old son and sick friend....but the room was terrific and the service great...we had an end room, number 401 and it was large with two double beds and a nice sized closet. The room was clean and nice, and their style is terrific....very eclectic modern, yet comfy. Very clean and service was awesome.....had friend with strep throat and they brought us up a shaker of salt at 3:00am to have him gargle! Just amazing. I have stayed here before with friend and also very very nice, great location and great bar downstairs as well......I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “pretentions to hipness and grandeur that fall short”
Reviews.Author: lilfella
