Reviews.Content: i stayed with colleagues for two nights at the zaza last week on business. it's totally over-rated. local colleagues, upon hearing that we were staying there, looked vaguely piteously at us. the worst thing is that the hotel thinks it's a sexy boutique, but it's not. witness the random taxidermy peacock in reception, the ugly paintings, the bar with bright over head lighting and poor acoustics. pluses: * molten brown toiletries. * comfy beds. * quiet rooms. * clean and modern. * tasty room service. * kobe beef carpaccio in the hotel restaurant. minuses: * unknowledgable concierge - he rattled out a recommendation for a restaurant for us before we even told him what kind of place we were looking for. * tacky decor - helmut newton cheapie prints abound, fake hand-written post it notes stuck on your bathroom mirror schilling the sister hotel in houston. the executive chair at the desk in your room is - vinyl? * terrible service in "happening" restaurant (dragonfly) - we had to negotiate for a table for 10 mins in a half-empty restaurant. the hostess tried to seat us in the "cocktail area" - a corner table behind the hostess stand with a plastic bench. how insulting. * no baths - not on our floor anyway, just a shower stall. why? there's lots of room. * eco lip service - you can re-use your towels to be green. but no recycling bins and no sign to re-use sheets. * no daily newpaper upon waking - there's a pile in reception. * business center - a JOKE! two terminals, one broken, painfully slow. we won't be back. it's not bad, just pretentious and a little bit sad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Fonter
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something at little out of the ordinary stay at the hotel Zaza. Everything about the place is unique. The quality of the service and back drops are not great, but if you can overlook the details it is worth the stay. We really loved the movies playing on the outside of the building when you arrive and depart in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Average ... But not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: g2980gj
Reviews.Content: My first stay at ZaZa. Nicer semi-upscale property. Got a great rate (<$200) making it a no-brainer. Like many of the hotels in this genre, lots of investment in trying to make it hip and boutique feeling ... but the service never lives up to expectations. Took them 15+ minutes to get me checked-in. Only one person working the desk and line of 3 people in front of me. Same in the lounge where the bartenders could barely find the inspiration to pour a guy a libation. My room was great. High quality finishes and touches. Loved the artwork all over the place. Will likely be back assuming I can continue to get good rates.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, lost reservation, and double billed!”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveller234
Reviews.Content: We booked and prepaid a month in advance. Arrived at the hotel, and were at first wowed by the decor. Unfortunately, that was short lived. They claimed to have no knowledge of our reservation. When I produced a receipt, they said they'd find us a room, and we should go to the bar and have appetizers - on them. Sounded like this was the right answer. We were then billed for the appetizers, our room had a pipe sticking out of the middle of the ceiling in the shower - that dripped constantly, even after maintenance came and fixed it. We then found that they had billed our credit card again for the hotel stay, despite having a copy of our receipt, showing we prepaid. It's three weeks later, and I'm still fighting them over the double billing. Their staff isn't particularly rude, they just really, really don't care.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and Happening”
Reviews.Author: islamujereslover
Reviews.Content: Hotel Zaza is a unique hotel with beautiful furnishings in a good location. Close to the Dallas Museum of Art and many spots to eat in the downtown (Uptown) area. Each room is nicely appointed with Burberry toiletries and a Vornado air cleaner. The Dragonfly restaurant is a meat market scene at night so unless you're in Dallas for hot hookups, I would go someplace else for dinner. Staff is courteous and service is good. Insider tip: The mini-bar, as usual, is $$$$ but there is a Shell 24-hour convenience store a 1/2 block away for all your wine/beer and even BBQ (yes BBQ) needs. Lots of restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: Ron_L_64
Reviews.Content: Usually very expensive, but found a deal through Expedia and directly through hotel. Rooms are some of the nicest I have stayed in - LCD TV, sofa, nice bathrooms. Wish I had more time to spend there.

Reviews.Title: “Spa questionable”
Reviews.Author: slimm1469
Reviews.Content: My room was luxurious, the over-all hotel environment was edgy but in liberal good taste. However, I did find the spa to be on the unusual side. First, it wasn't very clean. The men's dressing room was rather messy, appearing to be over-used and under-cleaned. Most surprising was the attitude of my therapist, a sexy Latin women who just seemed to be asking overly personal questions on my appointment. Her deep-tissue massage was extraordinary and traditional but, frankly, she began asking some pointedly personal questions afterward, like where I was from, how long I planned to stay, did I have any activities planned while in Dallas and would I "be seeing her again." This was accompanied by a lascivious smile. Look, I'm no fool, I've been around and am not flattering myself but it was a come-on. She gave me her personal business card. Her name was Thylda something, I didn't keep the card. I'm happily married, thank you, and plan to stay that way. Just watch yourself in the spa with this woman.

Reviews.Title: “What's the big deal?”
Reviews.Author: himark35
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this actually at the Hotel ZaZa, and have to confess I'm wondering what the hype is about. I just checked in, and found the front desk staff to be vacuous and inattentive, to the point that they helped people out of turn. I didn't rate this overly poorly, because the rooms are very nicely appointed, and the hotel seems to have a good quality feel. Maybe I just travel too much, several nights each week, but I have little time and patience for poor service regardless of decor and amenities. I have not eaten at the restaurant yet, but my advice based on the reviews I've seen would be to eat here, and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bohemian Suite at Zaza”
Reviews.Author: JackandSally
Reviews.Content: I will start off saying that I love Hotel ZaZa, I had one of the best weekends of my life there last year (my honeymoon) so I came back again this year for my first anniversary with high expectations. I decided to book a concept suite (they have several and many were available just days before my stay including: Shagadelic, Art, Far East, Out of Africa, East Indies, and Texas) to make the night even more special. We stayed in a balcony room on our first visit and loved it so I figured a concept suite (which costs almost twice as much) would be even better. When we stayed last year in the balcony room I enjoyed the music from Club Oasis (I do understand why other reviewers have complained about it, but for us it was like being inside a club all night- we kept the balcony doors open and went to sleep listening to the music.) I had originally booked the West Indies Suite as it has a balcony that overlooks the pool area but when I discovered that snow was in the forecast for the weekend (snow in Texas in April? Who would have thoughtâ€¦) I decided to change my reservation to the Bohemian Suite as it seemed cozier. The suite itself is beautiful with Antique furniture and interesting â€œBohemianâ€� art. There are several art books scattered throughout the room for guests to leisurely flip through. The bedroom area is elevated and a very interesting railing separates it from the living area. The room seems to be filled with fluffy pillows that made it seem even more luxurious. The bathroom, however, was a disappointment. The bathtub is small, there is only one sink, and there is no separate shower. I liked the dÃ©cor but expected more for the $515 price tag. The hotel itself is a lot of fun, eclectic without taking itself too seriously. I think my parents would find it silly, maybe even too strange, but for me itâ€™s unusual without sacrificing beauty. There is artwork and photographs throughout the hotel that make you pause and think. The corridor leading from the lobby to Dragonfly, the hotel restaurant, has a lot of seating that allows you to just relax and take in the music without having to enter the club area. The hotel is fairly small with approximately 150 rooms and suites on only 4 floors. The pool area and the balcony rooms offer fabulous views of downtown Dallas but the view from The Bohemian Suite, unfortunately, was on the other side and included some apartments and a dumpster, prompting us to keep the blinds closed the entire stay. The windows on any of the rooms that donâ€™t include balconies are pretty small so if you want an open feel and a view make sure to get a balcony. I did peek in at one of the standard rooms and the dÃ©cor is nice, Iâ€™m guessing the bathrooms in those rooms are probably arenâ€™t anything special since the ones in the upgraded rooms are underpar. I donâ€™t feel that the service at ZaZa is poor by any means but many of the employees do seem disinterested, especially those at the reception desk and at the entrance to the restaurant. The valet staff and wait staff at Dragonfly, however, are exceptionally helpful and friendly. I called reservations multiple times while trying to choose a room and found that I was always treated well on the phone and all of my questions were answered. Prior to our visit I tried to e-mail the concierge in order to make special arrangements for celebrating our anniversary and only received an automated reply that did not address my request. We enjoyed our meals at Dragonfly as always. I had the Tandori Prawns while my husband had the Ginger Wagyu Beef, both were wonderful. The cocktails are pricey ($12-$17) but good, the Peach Bellini in particular was very tasty. Breakfast was complimentary (sort of, the concept suite includes a $30 voucher for breakfast.) I had the steak and eggs while my husband got the Spinach â€œBennies.â€� We both got bottomless mimosas and our glasses were refilled every couple of minutes it seemed. We had a minor problem at checkout when we discovered that we had been charged $18 for valet parking. According to the website valet parking is complimentary when you book a concept suite. The woman at the reception desk initially didnâ€™t want to credit us for the valet parking and asked if we had booked the room online (concept suites canâ€™t be booked online, only over the phone) but since we had printed out everything the website said about the concept suites she relented. I was also charged for valet parking during my last stay even though the package I had booked was supposed to include it, so I always make sure to check my invoice before I leave. Overall I did not feel that it was worth it to stay in a concept suite, I donâ€™t feel I received any additional perks and would have been just as happy staying in a balcony room (I received a phone call from the hotel manager in response to a survey I completed after my stay and he said that he noted that I didn't feel that the suite was worth the extra money and he said that they want to see what they can do on my next stay to make up for it- I thought that was nice that he reads the guests comments. ) Next time I will try to stay when the weather is warmer and I can sit on my balcony sipping wine as the club music in pumping. But there will be a next time, most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Zaza”
Reviews.Author: fionamcs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week as my partner was on business and absolutely loved the Zaza. The hotel is well designed with lots of cute little features- lots of kitsch art (including Princess Diana coffee table book in foyer!). The staff are great as is the level of customer service. Would recommend Dragonfly restaurant- both food and wine fantastic (and I am hard to please), we ate there a couple of times. Bed really comfy and cleanliness exceptional. Would definitely recommend anyone staying but if I was going to be constructive I would suggest trying to book a room with a balcony in the Summer months particularly. Also the swimming looks inviting but is overlooked by the bar/ restaurant and is in the front of the hotel. Disagree with the comments about the noise - our room was soundproof.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Suite! Poor service! Super chic boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: minibargrrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon Suite for a birthday party in February. Let me say, this is the most amazing room I have ever stayed in! It's a two bedroom suite, and really wonderfully decorated. Full kitchen, two full bedrooms and bath. That aside, one of the bathroom showers didn't work, the main TV didn't work, and none of the electrical outlets worked in the second bathroom. Maintenence spent most of our first day there trying to fix the problems with no luck. The front desk staff is pretty rude in general, but I think that is part of the "feel" of the hotel. Our room was not ready at check-in time, we didn't get in the room unti 6:30pm, and no accomodations were made for this. We sat in the lobby with our party favors for three hours. The staff at Dragonfly, however, is awesome! They provided us with a private table and helped cut the birthday cake - what a great team!

Reviews.Title: “Good luck sleeping on Fri or Sat nite...”
Reviews.Author: grinkle
Reviews.Content: When we first checked in, apparently there had been a mix-up with dates (on their end). The woman we were dealing with was extremely unhelpful and we would have been out in the cold had her co-worker not stepped in. He cleared everything up within minutes. He obviously had a clue and was a good guy, whereas she was just cold and unhelpful altogether. She didn't even apologize about her mistake. The hotel has a funky vibe and the room was extremely comfortable. The elevators are so dark i literally thought that the lights were broken or something. Not so comfortable when there's more than you and a friend standing in there. Our room had a balcony that overlooked the courtyard area that is next to the restaurant (Dragonfly), which at first i thought was great, but we were to be in for a surprise later on... Apparently every Friday and Saturday nite, that area turns into a little "nightclub" type scene complete with a DJ and booming PA system (all under a tent). If you plan on staying either of those nights during the week, be aware of the whereabouts of your room and whether it overlooks the courtyard or not. Unless you have no problem with the annoying, throbbing "oonst oonst" pulsing and blaring through the walls and windows at 1AM while you're just trying to get some good ol shut-eye. Even with the balcony door double shut (there's a slider in addition to the door itself) and the curtains closed, it was maddening. Consider yourself forewarned.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, inept and rude with great rooms”
Reviews.Author: lpqmember
Reviews.Content: If you stay at Hotel Zaza, expect hip and great looking decor, large well furnished rooms and nice marble baths. Just don't expect any service. Rude staff hung the phone up on us when we called to ask for assistance. Housekeeping cleaned our room at 4:40 pm instead of morning. Front desk personnel are inept and no one seems to care about guests because the bar scene on the weekends is a big draw among the young Dallas beautiful crowd. We stay at 5 star hotels all over the world and have come to expect good service and polite service. Please don't expect that here. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Modern, Elegant”
Reviews.Author: jte
Reviews.Content: This is a very trendy hotel. Spend some time looking at the art, photographs, and collages up on the walls. The rooms are spacious, modern and clean. Bathroom is wonderful. The shower is almost a retreat in itself. Things are a bit cramped in the circle drive entry, the lobby, and the bar. It is definitely a place to see and be seen. The walls and floors/ceilings are a bit thin...we could hear the toy chihuahua next door and the people above us walking around. It kind of reminded me of my apartment! All in all, a very nice, trendy hotel. Recommended for a good night out...but not for a relaxing retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Good room no sleep”
Reviews.Author: bgou
Reviews.Content: ZaZa is outwardly beautiful and if you are into partying and people watching it is a great place to stay. We stayed in the ZaZa suite, supposedly the nicest in the hotel, and it was fabulous. Opulent, well furnished and extremely neat. The rest of the hotel is a bit cramped including the lobby, restaurant and bar. The people watching is great but if you want to go to bed before 3:00 Am on the weekend and you are facing the front of the hotel you can forget it. Loud techno music blasts from the bar and can be heard and felt four floors up. Overall a nice hotel but it can't decide if it is a night spot or a luxury hotel. It only succeeded on the former.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel ZaZa Dallas
HotelInfo.Address: 2332 Leonard St, Dallas, TX 75201
